chinese: 家人见他这般光景，问：“是怎么了？” 少不得撒谎说：“天黑了，失脚掉在茅厕里了。”
english: When the servant who answered the gate saw the state he was in and asked him how it had happened, he had to pretend that he had been out in the darkness to ease himself and had fallen into the jakes.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: His family asked him how he was, "What's wrong?" They had to lie: "It got dark, and he fell down on the toilet."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The details of her condition were told to the servant; 'What's wrong with her?' and 'She fell into the bathroom at night,' he embellied.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: When his family saw him in this state, they asked, "What's wrong?" They had no choice but to lie and say, "It was dark; I fell and landed in the toilet."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The members of the family inquired what was wrong, and Guan Yutian had to tell them a lie in order not to bother them. 'It's getting dark. I was walking in the dark and slipped and fell in the toilet,' he said.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: When his family saw him in this state, they asked, "What happened?" He inevitably lied, saying, "It was dark, and I stumbled and fell into the outhouse."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The servants, observing the state he was in, asked what had happened. He had to lie and say that he had tripped up in the dark and fallen into the pigsty.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: People in his family saw him in such a state and asked, "What happened?" He couldn't help but lie and said, "It's just that it's dark and I accidentally fell into the outhouse."
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The servants saw this state he was in and asked him what had happened. There was no choice but to lie: 'It's got dark. I've tripped over a dung-pit.'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Family members asked him about his appearance: "What happened?" He lied and said: "It's dark, I fell in the outhouse."
What's wrong with you?' asked his servant. Bao-yu lied: 'It's dark. I've fallen in a ditch.'

chinese: 没有比流言更能胡编乱造，信口雌黄的了。
english: No one is better at making up stories, telling lies, and wagging its tongue than gossip.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: There is no better way of fabricating rumors than with a lie or half-truths.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): None of what I say is the business of fact, anyway; it could be called胡编乱造，也可能是自以为神明之罚，贴在墙上的歪画。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: There is nothing more false and baseless than gossip, which can be fabricated and spread without end.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Coarse rumors are capable of making the most fantastic claims and can be counted among the greatest liars.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: There is nothing more fabricated and made up than gossip.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): There is nothing as make-believe as gossip—verities cannot be twisted as freely.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: There is no one more skilled at spreading rumors and fabricating lies than those who speak from their own imagination.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: There is no gossip that lies more brazenly than rumor.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: There is nothing more adept at fabricating and concocting falsehoods than gossip. Lies have become second nature.
There is no gossip more brazenly shameless than the kind that comes out of the mouths of women.

chinese: 左手在桌上轻轻一拍，道：“定当如此！
english: He tapped the table lightly with his left hand and continued speaking, apparently to himself. 'Yes, of course. This is obviously the solution.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Left-handed, he softly patted the table, saying, "I'll do it that way!
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He pressed his hand against the table and scored a quiet agreement, 'I'll remember that...'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He tapped the table with his left hand, saying, "I will indeed do that!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There was a small sound at the table as he said this, but he spoke on regardless.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The left hand tapped gently on the table, saying, "It shall be thus!"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): He tapped the table lightly with his left hand. 'I'll see that it's done.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Left hand lightly taps the table and says, "It will be so!"
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: He rapped the desk lightly with his left hand. 'It's decided, then.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The left hand lightly taps on the table and says: "It shall be as such!"
The left hand on the table spoke: 'That's about it.

chinese: 哑巴扛着一盘长方形的平整土地用的、周遭二十六根铁尖齿的耙，另有三个队员各扛着一盘。
english: Mute was toting a rake with twenty-six metal tines, as were three other soldiers.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: A blind man with a flat-shaped land that he was using for plowing with two-six-inch steel teeth hammers, as well as three others, each carrying one.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Butch was carrying a rectangular piece of level land, the blades of which he called 'iron plow wedges,' two each by the by. There were three other soldiers with pairs of the blades.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The mute carries a long rectangular plough, with twenty-six iron tines surrounding it, and three other men each carry one.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): With his shoulder on the equipment, a giant circular rake shaped like a table with twenty-six steel bar spikes sharpened at the edge, he was accompanied by three other workers each carrying a similar device.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: A mute carries a square, flat-topped plow with twenty-six iron tines around it, and three team members each carry one.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Mute carried a long, flat piece of earth,齿ed on all sides by twenty-six iron teeth, another team member carried each end.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Carrying a rectangular flat piece of land with twenty-six iron spikes around it, there are three teams of workers, each carrying one.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Mute carried a flat spade with twenty-six teeth, and three other soldiers carried similar spades.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Worker carrying a square flat sheet of leveling soil using a rake with 26 iron teeth, three other team members each carrying one.
The mute carried a flat disk of leveled earth on a twenty-six-toothed ploughshare, and the other three team members carried similar disks.

chinese: 商店里有一个售货员在打瞌睡，还有很多苍蝇在飞。
english: Inside one store a saleswoman dozed while a swarm of flies circled around.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: There is a salesman at the store who is sleeping on his phone. There are flies flying around.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There was a salesperson at one store asleep, and flies were buzzing around the shop.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: sleeping, and there are many flies flying around.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): A saleswoman was sleeping at the store, and many flies were buzzsing around.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: dozing off, and there were also many flies flying around.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): There was a saleswoman dozing at the counter and many flies flying around.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: There is a salesperson in the store who is sleeping and there are many flies flying around.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: An attendant was dozing at the counter, and flies buzzed all around him.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The store has an employee napping, and there are many flies flying around.
The shop was empty, except for the cashier, who was dozing at the counter, and numerous flies buzzing around.

chinese: 她指了屋角，说那里有她的一杯茶，不必了。
english: She pointed to the corner and said that she already had a cup of tea, so there was no need.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: She pointed at a corner and said that there was her cup of tea; she did not need it then.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She pointed inside the corner. Say goodbye to your cup of tea.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: She pointed to a corner of the room and said there was her cup of tea, no need for it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She pointed to the corner of the room and said where she drank her tea. She didn't need any more.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: She pointed to a corner of the room, indicating there was a cup of tea for her there, but she didn't want it.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): She pointed in the direction of a teacup that she had left in a corner and said that she had already poured tea for herself and that there was no need to refill it.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: She pointed to the corner of the room, saying there was a cup of tea that belonged to her, and she did not need it.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She pointed to a corner of the room. 'There's a cup of tea over there. Help yourself.'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: She pointed to a corner, saying there was her cup of tea there, no need anymore.
She pointed to a corner and said, That's where they kept the tea. No need to tell me.

chinese: 他记挂着扔在围子上的粪筐和粪铲，不由自主地往后歪头，一柄雪亮的刺刀从他的腮帮子旁边欻啦顺过来。
english: Concerned about the dung basket he'd left on the wall, Pocky Cheng instinctively cocked his head in that direction. A bayonet that shone like snow flashed past his cheek.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: He recalled the litter in the basket, and his mind automatically shifted forward, as if a sharp blade had flashed past his cheekbone.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The cuticles of his hand grew sticky from neglect, and he自觉脑袋上一挺,印落了地面的钢刀嗖的一声,正擦到福镜的腮边皮擦过。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He was remembering the dung pail and shovel that had been left on the fence, and involuntarily he turned his head backwards, a bright dagger snaking down along the side of his cheekbone.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He couldn't help turning his head slowly, tilting it towards the heap of manure and spade, and sliding a bright bayonet blade between his cheeks.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: He was reminded of the dung pail and shovel left on the yard, causing him to involuntarily tilt his head back. A gleaming bayonet swept past his cheek.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): He was thinking about the dung basket and shovel he'd left outside the village wall, and turned his head that way involuntarily. A bright blade whizzed past his cheek.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: He remembers hanging the bucket and shovel on the fence, and they naturally lean to one side. A shiny dagger suddenly appears from the side of his cheek.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: As he hung the basket and shovels on the fence, his head jerked back of its own accord, and a glinting bayonet sliced his cheek.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: He tilted his head back unconsciously, and a snow-white dagger glided smoothly from the side of his cheek towards him. The excrement bucket and shovel, thrown onto the ground around the fence, were ignored.
He staggered under the weight of the dung basket and the shovel he hung over his shoulder, and bent his head, allowing a snow-white bayonet to slide down beside him.

chinese: 她掀起轿帘，看着那个吃拤饼的人。
english: She raised the curtain to get a glimpse of the man who ate fistcakes.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: She raised her arm, looking at that man eating a pancake.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She raising the curtain revealed the man who was eating fistcakes.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: She raised the screen and looked at the man eating the steamed bun.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She raised the curtain a bit to make out the man stuffing cake into his fist.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: She lifted the curtain of the sedan chair and looked at the man eating a kaipao.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): She lifted the curtain and looked down at the man eating the fistcake.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: She lifted the curtain and looked at the person eating rice gruel.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She lifted the curtain to see the man eating fistcakes.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: She lifted the curtains, looking at the person eating steamed buns.
She lifted the curtain and looked at the man.

chinese: 你难道就知道你的心，不知道我的心不成？”
english: Do you mean to tell me that you know your own feelings about me but still don't know what my feelings are about you?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Do you know your own heart? Do not you know your own mind?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): If you don't know what you're talking about, you cannot tell me what I'm doing.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Do you know only your heart, and not my heart?”
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Well all I can tell you is what's going on in my own heart. If you don't know what's going on in my heart, why should we?'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Can't you see beyond your own heart, and understand mine?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Think you're the only one with a heart?
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Can you know your own heart but not mine?"
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: -You think you are the only one with a heart? You don't think I have a heart?'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Do you know your own heart, but not mine?"
You think you know what's in my heart, but you don't know what's in your own!'

chinese: 轿子起行，忽悠悠似腾云驾雾，偷懒的吹鼓手在出村不远处就停止了吹奏，轿夫们的脚下也快起来。
english: Off they went, floating along as though riding the clouds or sailing through a mist. Shortly after leaving the village, the lazy musicians stopped playing, while the bearers quickened their pace.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The carriage moves with a light, fluid movement, like floating through clouds and fog. The lazy flutist stopped blowing at the edge of the village and the footmen were already moving up.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The sedan chair moved slowly up the street, as though soaring through the cloud, or even as it was merging with the雾海， when the musicians stopped playing and the bearers stopped breathing, letting the passengers feel the rush of motion.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The sedan chair began to move, and it seemed as if the carriage driver were riding on a cloud of magic. The lazy trumpeters stopped blowing their horns at some distance out of the village, and the carriage drivers' feet quickened pace.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As they set off again, all system of bells and drums seemed to have gone loose and the musicians had drifted off some distance from the village before stopping altogether. The bearers hurried on, feet accelerating as the riders grew restless.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The sedan chair began its journey, and suddenly it felt as if they were ascending clouds or riding on a mist. The lazy musicians stopped playing their instruments not far from the village entrance, and the bearers quickened their pace.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): As the bearers lifted the sedan chair to set out once more, a strange hush seemed to fall over the village, broken only by the lazy sounds of the musicians' instruments.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The sedan chair rose up, and it seemed as if it were being carried by the clouds. The lazy drummer stopped blowing his drum when he was not far from the village. The sedan chair bearers' feet were quick to move.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: As the sedan chair set out, it soared along like a cloud floating across the mist. The lazy musicians stopped playing as soon as they were out of the village, and the bearers quickened their steps.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The carriage sets off, moving swiftly like a cloud skimming the mist. The lazy drummer stopped playing his drum not far from the village, and the footmen also quickened their pace.

As the sedan chair began to move, it seemed to soar upward like a cloud floating in the mist, and the musicians, growing lazy, stopped playing their instruments a short distance from the village, allowing their footsteps to quicken.

chinese: 黄宗羲道：“是啊。
english: 'Quite,' said Huang.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: That is indeed so.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I'm afraid so, ' said Huang.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Liu Zongxun said, "Yes."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I'm afraid so, ' said Huang.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Huang Zhongxie said, "Yes."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): I'm afraid so, ' said Huang.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Is that so."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: 'I'm afraid so,'said Huang.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Zhuang Zhou said: "Yes."
I'm afraid so, ' said Huang.

chinese: 然后他们到一间为游客开的通宵酒吧中去坐了两个多小时，沙瑞山一杯接着一杯地灌啤酒，变得更加健谈，而汪淼却早已心神不定，脑子里不断地浮现出那条绿色直线。
english: Then they went to an all-night bar for tourists and sat for two hours. As Sha finished one beer after another, his tongue loosened even more. But Wang became anxious, and his mind kept returning to that green line on the terminal in Sha's office.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Then they went to a bar for tourists open late that night, where they drank two or three hours of beer before drinking one more. Shuhuang Shan was talking more loudly than ever as he sipped on another glass of beer. And Wu Miao had already drifted off to sleep, thinking about that green line in his mind.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Then they went to a bar open for visitors, and Sha drank to his taste while chatting with the other visitors all night long — until the end he was barely able to keep his eyes on the green line.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Then they sat there for two hours at a tourist bar open all night, where Shari said things that were not very interesting but made him talk more, while Meng Jiangnan had already been restless and kept thinking of the green line.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): So, they sat at a place reserved for tourists in a late-night bar. Sha downed beer after beer, getting louder and more animated; while Wang's heart grew increasingly uneasy. What was that green line supposed to be?
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Then they went to a 24-hour bar for tourists where they spent more than two hours. Shasri drank beer after beer, becoming increasingly talkative, while Wang Miao was already restless, his mind constantly replaying that green line.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Then they went to a bar that had been opened for tourists twenty-four hours a day and sat there for more than two hours. Sha drank beer sequentially, becoming more talkative. But Wang was already distracted, his mind filled with the green line.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Then they went to a bar open all night for tourists and sat there for two hours. They drank one beer after another, and Wang Shui became increasingly nervous. The green line kept popping up in his mind.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Then they went to a bar open to tourists, where they sat for over two hours, as Sha consumed beer after beer, growing more and more talkative, while Wang became more and more distracted.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: They went to a bar open for tourists that stayed open all night and sat there for more than two hours. Sha Rui Shan kept drinking beer after beer, becoming more and more talkative, while Wang Wan was already restless and unsettled, with a green line constantly appearing in his mind.

After that, they went to a twenty-four-hour bar catering to tourists and stayed there for two hours. Sha continued to drink beer after beer and grew more and more boisterous, while Wang's mind grew increasingly unsettled and the green line appeared more frequently in his thoughts.

chinese: 雨水把奶奶的衣服也打湿了，她本来可以挂上轿帘遮挡雨水，她没有挂，她不想挂，奶奶通过敞亮的轿门，看到了纷乱不安的宏大世界。
english: Her clothes, too, were soaked. She could have covered herself with the curtain, but she didn't; she didn't want to, for the open front of the sedan chair afforded her a glimpse of the outside world in all its turbulence and beauty.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Rainwater had soaked her clothes as well; she could have draped them over a轿帘抵挡雨水的侵袭， but she did not do so; she didn’t want to do so, and she saw the chaos and disorder of the great world through the open轿门。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Grandma had also been planning to hang up her clothes, but she decided not to. She simply climbed through the open door of the sedan chair and gazed out at the chaotic world outside.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Raindrops had soaked her grandmother's clothes, and she could have covered them with a canopy like the one that her father had used when they were young, but she didn't. Instead, she looked out of the open door of the carriage at the chaotic vastness of the world outside.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The rainwater soaked her clothes, but she had left the curtain open and, as a result, was able to see the chaotic, spacious world outside without shielding.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The rain had also drenched Grandma's clothes, but she didn't bother to hang up the sedan chair curtain to shield herself from the rain. She chose not to do so. Through the open sedan chair door, Grandma was able to see the vast and tumultuous world outside.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The rain had also soaked Grandma's clothes. She could have asked them to raise the curtain to shield her from the rain, but she didn't want to, preferring to continue looking out the open doorway at the chaotic view of the world below.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The rainwater soaked the grandmother's clothes, but she could have hung them up to cover them with the curtain. However, she did not want to do so, and instead chose to leave them exposed. Through the open doorway, she saw the chaotic and unstable world.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The rain had soaked through Grandma's clothing. She could have closed the curtain to keep dry, but she didn't want to; she wanted to look out the open door and see the chaotic world outside.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The rain also wet grandmother's clothes, she could have hung the sunshade to shield the rain, but she didn't hang it, she didn't want to hang it, grandmother looked at the chaotic and vast world through the open carriage door.

The rain water soaked her clothes. She could have raised the curtain to protect herself from the rain, but she didn't want to. She stared out the open doorway of the carriage at the chaotic world outside.

chinese: 那东西一听别人谈到它，就激昂起来，蠢动个不停。
english: As soon as the thing heard people talking about him, he became excited and began to stir.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: It sounds as if it is being excited by what others say about it. It will continue to be a bit sluggish.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The things listening to other people talking about their bells danced crazily, as if they were moving endlessly.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: It gets excited every time it hears about itself, and flutters around incessantly.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The thing, once hear it talk, got excited and twitched all over.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The thing would become agitated and restless upon hearing others talk about it.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Upon hearing his name mentioned, that thing would become excited and begin moving around in its cage.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The topic of that thing makes me so excited and restless whenever someone talks about it.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Once someone mentioned it, it would get excited and move around incessantly.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: That thing gets excited whenever someone mentions it and moves restlessly.
Those things would get excited just from hearing people talk about them.

chinese: 这一条，你能办到么？”
english: Do you think you are capable of keeping that rule?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Can you do this?”
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But what do you think?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Can you do it, sir?”
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Can you do this, Goong-goong?'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Can you do this one?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Can you do that?'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Can you do this?</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Is that something you can do?'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Can you manage this task?"
Now—is that something you could do?'

chinese: 多么丑恶的东西，我上半生一直在用文学这把解剖刀来揭露这种丑恶，现在连这种揭露都厌倦了。
english: 'The human race is hideous. I've spent the first half of my life unveiling this ugliness with the scalpel of literature, but now I'm even sick of the work of dissection.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: What a vile thing it is! I have always used literature as a knife to expose such a vile thing, now that I no longer find it attractive.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): What a repulsive thing he is, and how deeply has I spent my life揭露它这丑恶的全部岁月! I've become so tired of it that I don't even want to continue.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: What hideous thing, I have been using this literary scalpel all my life to expose such ugliness. Now even the exposing is tiresome.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): How ugly these things were. I used my surgical knife, the only tool at my disposal, to expose this ugliness for most of my life. Now even I'm tired of exposing it.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: How vile things they are! For half my life, I've been using the scalpel of literature to expose this ugliness, but now even the act of exposing it bores me.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): How repellent! I spent the first half of my life using literature to expose this ugliness, and now even the exposing seems boring.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: How repulsive it is! I have been using literature to expose this ugliness for most of my life, but now I am tired of even doing that.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: I've spent a whole lifetime exposing the ugliness of literature, and now I'm sick of it.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Such a vile thing, I have been using literature as a dissecting knife to expose this kind of vile nature for half my life, and now I am even tired of exposing it.
It is such an ugly thing that I have been using the scalpel of literature all my life to dissect it. Now I am sick of even exposing it.

chinese: 虽然我奶奶与他已经在高粱地里凤凰和谐，在那个半是痛苦半是幸福的庄严过程中，我奶奶虽然也怀上了我的功罪参半但毕竟是高密东北乡一代风流的父亲，但那时奶奶是单家的明媒正娶的媳妇，爷爷与她总归是桑间濮上之合，带着相当程度的随意性偶然性不稳定性，况且我父亲也没落土，所以，写到那时候的事，我还是称呼他余占鳌更为准确。
english: Even though by then he and Grandma had already done the phoenix dance in the sorghum field, and even though, in the solemn course of suffering and joy, she had conceived my father, whose life was a mixture of achievements and sin (in the final analysis, he gained distinction among his generation of citizens of Northeast Gaomi Township), she had nonetheless been legally married into the Shan family. So she and Granddad were adulterers, their relationship marked by measures of spontaneity, chance, and uncertainty. And since Father wasn't born while they were together, accuracy demands that I refer to Granddad as Yu Zhan'ao in writing about this period.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Although my grandmother was already a high-crop farmer's daughter in the spirit of harmony with him in the solemn period where he had been born on the half-burdened and half-pleasure of his life, even though she had also given birth to my guilt and righteousness, but that was still a son-in-law from the prosperous Eastman clan generation of the Qing dynasty, who was indeed fatherless and single motherhood at that time, yet I did not know how much her father was attached to me, so when I wrote about those things then, I called him "Remi" more accurately than "Liu Qiuxin".
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Even though she was now pregnant, Grandma had been high schooler at the time. Since that moment she had entered into a love affair with my crime, both tragic and gloriously extravagant. For that matter, she had been the bride of the Zhang family, the maiden-in-waitting of my marriage, and therefore, since my father had not yet set foot on land, we called her Remi's little girl. More importantly than that, the topic of discussion about those days was never referred to as Yu Zhan'ao: it remained purely arbitrary. And finally, even my father, who had not yet left the fork of the mountain, could hardly be called随意的，因为他的存在只能从外人看来。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Although my grandmother was at peace with him among the millet fields, in that solemn process of cohabitation marked by pain and happiness, although she was also carrying half a load of my sins and virtues, after all, she was still the father of the Fengjia County, the noble bride of the Northern Plains, but then, my grandmother was only the single housewife who was married by arrangement; her husband and she were more or less free and accidental. Moreover, my father hadn't yet fallen into the ground, so when I wrote about those events, I still called him Yu Quanliao more accurately.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Even though Great-Grandma had consummated her love for Father in the sorghum field, and although she had, with half pain, half pleasure, become a clear-cut marriage partner of the single Wang clan head, it was still Father who fathered my current existence, even though he hadn't quite lost his footing in society. So when I came to write about this time in his life, I continued to refer to him as Yu Zhan'ao. He was still a very effective name.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Although my grandmother had already achieved harmony with him in the millet field, a process that was a mix of pain and happiness, during which she also conceived my father who embodies both virtues and vices, she was still the legitimate wife of the respected father figure from Gaomai's Northeast Township at that time. Grandfather and she were married in a traditional Chinese ceremony, yet their union carried a certain level of unpredictability and instability. Moreover, my father had not yet been buried, so when it comes to recounting those events, referring to him as Yu Zhanao is more precise.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Although Grandma had already enjoyed a consummated union with Father Guan under the sorghum, in which she had conceived me, her biological link to the next generation, she was still the legally married wife of Mengyang Song, and their union, taking place in the natural environment of song and流水, had been entirely arbitrary, lacking in direction and stability. My father still hadn't been buried, so when it came to writing about that time, it was more accurate to refer to him as Yu Zhan'ao.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Although my grandmother had a tumultuous relationship with my grandfather, and although she was also partly responsible for the troubles that ensued, she was still considered the wife of a respected man from the village. My grandfather and she had a rather unstable and unpredictable relationship, as they were not married in the traditional sense. Moreover, my father had fallen on hard times, so it is more accurate to refer to him as "Yu Zhan" when discussing this period of time.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Even though Grandma had flown to the high cornfields in the company of a man who was half the cause of her suffering and half the cause of her happiness, a man who, as the son of a wealthy man from Northeast Gaomi Township, was in any case a local nobleman, she was, at the time, a married woman whose union had been arranged by her parents; and since Granddad was a poor man, his relationship with her was more the casual and tenuous kind that you might call adulterous. So, when the time came to write about those days, 'Yu Zhan' was the more appropriate name for him.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Although my grandmother was already in harmony with him in the millet field, in that solemn process half of pain and half of happiness, my grandmother, although she bore some of my guilt, was still a refined father from a high-ranking family in northeastern China. However, my grandmother was a single woman who was officially married to my grandfather. My grandfather and she were more like a match made in heaven, with a certain degree of casualness, randomness, and instability. Moreover, my father had not settled down, so I still referred to him as Yue Ou Chi at that time, which was more accurate.

Even though my grandma had become one with the phoenix in the sorghum field, and the marriage between my granddad and her was a mixed blessing of pain and happiness, my father, son of a northeastern black-buck ram, was only adopted into the Shan family, so that by that time he was still considered a guest. Moreover, he hadn't yet fathered a child, so calling him Yu Zhan'ao seemed more accurate.

chinese: 他甚是得意，说道：“嗯，右脸刻一堆牛粪，可没人出钱来买牛粪的，不如刻只猪，又肥又蠢，生意一定好。”
english: This gave him great satisfaction and inspired him to further idiocy. 'Hm, a cow-pat on the right cheek—no, I don't think anyone's going to pay good money for that. A fat pig would be better—a great big, fat, stupid-looking pig. That would sell.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: He was delighted: "Yes, a lot of people would rather not pay for the dung on their right cheeks than to carve a pig, which is much more tasty but also smarter."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Good!' he said. 'From left to right, the face says cattle. No one's going to spend money on a buffalo to etch a 'horse' with. I think, then, that we'd better start selling chicken skins instead.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He was very pleased and said, "Hmm, I'll carve some dung on the right side of my face. No one will pay for it because they don't want to buy dung. Why not carve a pig? It's fat and stupid. I'm sure that will be a good business."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): That'll show them!' he said, as he set about刻着一排牛粪。 'A pig, fatter and bigger than anything you've ever seen! That's sure to do me more business than a cow.'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: He was quite pleased with himself, saying, "Well, a face carved with a pile of cow dung is interesting, but no one would pay for cow dung. Instead, carve a pig, which is both fat and foolish. Business would surely be good."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): He was obviously pleased with his handiwork. 'Mm, a cow's dung ball on the right cheek would not be very popular as a souvenir. Better carve something people could actually take home with them. A pig, for instance. Fat and stupid. That should do very well.'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: He said, "Yes, it's true. If we carve a pile of cow dung on the right cheek, no one would buy it. But if we carve a pig, it would be both fat and stupid. Business would definitely be good."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: He sounded very pleased with himself. 'A pig's trotter: that's what I'll carve. No one will be able to refuse to buy it. And a pig is fattener and more stupid than a deer's hoof. A pig-carver's trade must be a good one.'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: He is quite proud, saying: "Ah, carve a pile of cow dung on the right side of my face, but no one will pay money to buy cow dung. It would be better to carve a pig, both fat and stupid, the business will definitely be good."
Ha!' said Trinket, 'You'd never get money for a cow-pat, but a pig with a tattooed face would be worth a fortune. You'd make a fortune!'

chinese: 吾今始悟作画意， 痛哭流涕有若是。
english: Now that I seem to read the painter's mind, My bitter teardrops match his drizzling rain.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I now understand that I began to paint this way of thinking, and shed tears for such a moment.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Only after too soon do I realize That画画只是填空和流泪的手段。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I have at last understood the meaning of painting, and am weeping bitterly as I do so.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Now I begin to understand the purpose behind the painting: and I could hardly control my sorrow as I spilled tears over it.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct:
I now understand the intent of painting, 
weeping with emotion as if it were so.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Only now do I understand what painting is: I weep with pain and shame.'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: I have finally understood the meaning behind painting and I am crying tears of joy.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: I can understand now what the painting was about and begin to weep.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: I have just begun to understand the meaning of painting, and I weep bitterly, flowing tears like a river.
The painting was now complete and as she looked at it she was struck with a sudden dread.

chinese: 凤姐笑道：“像你这样的人能有几个呢，十个里也挑不出一个来！”
english: 'But how many men are there like you?' said Xi-feng. 'I doubt you could find one in ten.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Feng Xiaogang laughed: “How many can you pick out of ten? No one’s picked out.”
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As you can see,' said Xi-feng with a disarming smile,' there are many such people in the house who would outweigh even the wildest imaginings.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Feng Jie said with a smile, "There aren't many people like you; there is not one person in ten that would be worth choosing!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Xi-feng laughed. 'I don't know how many there are as clever as you. I can't think of more than a dozen.'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The Countess Feng laughed, saying, "How many people like you are there? You can hardly find one out of ten!"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Xi-feng laughed. 'Fortunately there aren't many people like you! I wouldn't put more than ten of them in a room together without selecting them first!'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Like that, she said, "There aren't many people like you, and even among ten people, I couldn't find one."
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Xi-feng laughed: 'Of all the people like you I could name, she would be the last I should choose to recommend!'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Sister Phoenix said, "How many like you can there be? I can't even pick one out from ten!"
Xi-feng laughed. 'There are lots of people like him. You won't find one in a hundred, maybe.'

english: 'Ha! I thought that was the most unrealistic aspect,' the software company vice president said. 'I conducted a test with more than a hundred employees at my company. Even if the idea worked, a computer made of people would probably operate at a speed slower than manual computation.'

chinese: 奶奶撕下轿帘，塞到轿子角落里，她呼吸着自由的空气，看着余占鳌的宽肩细腰。
english: Grandma ripped the curtain from the front of the carriage and stuffed it behind the seat. As she breathed the free air she studied Yu Zhan'ao's broad shoulders and narrow waist.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Her grandmother tore off the carriage curtain and put it in a corner of the carriage. She breathed the free air around her as she looked at Lu Qiuqiang’s broad shoulders and lean waist.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Grandma pulled the curtain away from her and stuffed it in the corner. She breathed in the free air, enjoying the handsome, well-defined design of Yu Zhan'ao's muscle-built body.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Grandma tore the curtain away and placed it in a corner of the轿子, she took in fresh air, and looked at Uncle Yu's broad shoulders and slim waist.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She tore away the curtain and stuffed it under a corner of the sedan chair, taking in the fresh air with pleasure and gazing up at Yu Zhan'ao's figure, so fit and fine.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Grandmother tore down the sedan chair's curtain and stuffed it into a corner of the chair. She breathed in the free air around her, watching Yu Zhanao with his broad shoulders and slender waist.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Grandma tore off the curtain and stuffed it into a corner of the carriage. She breathed in the air of freedom as she looked at Yu Zhan'ao's broad shoulders and narrow waist.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Grandma tore down the curtains, pushed them into the corner of the sedan chair, and breathed in the fresh air while admiring the broad shoulders and slim waist of Yu Zhan.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She ripped away the curtain and stuffed it into a corner of the carriage; then she breathed the fresh air, looking at Yu Zhan'ao's broad shoulders and slender waist.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Grandmother pulled down the carriage curtain, stuffed it into a corner of the carriage, she breathed in the free air, looking at Yue Zhanwu with broad shoulders and narrow waist.
Grandma ripped the curtain away and stuffed it into a corner of the carriage, where she could breathe in the free air, taking in the sight of Yu Zhan'ao's broad shoulders and narrow waist.

chinese: 道路两边，板块般的高粱坚固凝滞，连成一体，拥拥挤挤，彼此打量，灰绿色的高粱穗子睡眼未开，这一穗与那一穗根本无法区别，高粱永无尽头，仿佛潺潺流动的河流。
english: Barriers of sorghum stalks lining the path stood erect and solid in unbroken rows, tightly packed, together sizing one another up with the yet unopened clay-green eyes of grain ears, one indistinguishable from the next, as far as she could see, like a vast river.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: On each side of the road, rows of tall rice stalks stand like pillars, interlocking, filling up with space, gazing at one another, gray-green stalks of rice waiting for a glance. This rice always runs dry, as if it were flowing from a river.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Beneath the boulders were dense, like a mixture of large sorghum bricks, which did not move smoothly apart; they looked at each other in dark green eyes that had yet to open gray: one穗一穗都无法区分开来，似乎这涓涓细流就是长在我们身上的。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: On either side of the road, rows of sturdy, solid sorghums stand tall and immobile like blocks. They grow closely together, gazing at each other, their green heads closed in sleep. The stalks have no end; they seem to be a flowing river.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): On the dirt road, spaced out like mathematical tiles, stalks of sorghum stood firm and rigid, sleepless, with gray-green leaves; these lines of crops merged into one, holding one another悄悄观察。 The end of the line appeared no closer or farther than the beginning, as if they were part of a flowing river.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Along both sides of the road, the stalks of sorghum, like板块, are sturdy and stagnant, forming a unified mass that is densely packed. They scrutinize each other, with the grayish-green tassels of the sorghum still in a state of sleep, making it impossible to distinguish one from another. The sorghum stretches endlessly, reminiscent of a flowing river.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Sorghum stalks, grey-green buds still closed, lined up shoulder to shoulder on both sides of the road, as though packed tightly together to form an impenetrable wall, muttering to one another.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Along the road, there are clusters of tall reeds, firmly rooted and intertwined, pressing against each other, gazing at each other, with their grey-green heads nodding off as if they were one body. It's as if they were endless rivers flowing silently.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The sorghum on the roadsides grew into solid clumps, undulating endlessly, each ear indistinguishable from the next, like an unending river.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Along the sides of the road, there are blocks of dense, solid millet, forming a single entity, packed closely together, sizing each other up, with the gray-green millet stalks still closed-eyed, indistinguishable from one another. The millet field seems to have no end, resembling a flowing river.

The roadbed was covered with a layer of compacted sorghum stalks the colour of slate. Sorghum heads slept with their eyes closed, merging into one another until the road disappeared beneath a solid wall of green.

chinese: 可巧凤姐正在上房算了输赢帐，听见后面一片声嚷，便知是李嬷嬷老病发了，又值他今儿输了钱，迁怒于人，排揎宝玉的丫头。
english: Xi-feng happened to be in Grandmother Jia's room totting up the day's scores for the final settlement when she heard this hubbub in the rear apartment. She identified it immediately as Nannie Li on the rampage once more, taking out on Bao-yu's unfortunate maids some of the spleen occasioned by her recent gambling losses.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I happen to overhear a rumble of excitement from within the room as Queen Fei was preparing for the final match. She heard it and knew that Mr. Mucch’s old age had set in. He had just lost money on his last bet, so he was furious at the people around him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Rong-mao was at that moment working out a win and winning over李嬷嬷的一些赌钱数目，在此意外产生，迫使他将脸皮子往好处上看，并将宝玉的丫鬟贾芸给定夺了。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Lucky for it, Miss Fanny was just calculating the results of her bets upstairs when she heard a commotion behind her. She knew that it was Old Mrs. Bee’s old bout with her health, and that this time she had lost money on account of the bet, so she was now venting her anger at others and throwing the maid of the little boy out.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Just at that moment Xi-feng was calculating the results of a game of gambling in her upstairs room and heard screaming voices coming from the servants' quarters. It was obvious, from the voice, that they were struggling with Nannie Li's toothy excitement; and since Jia Rui had lost money that day and had naturally to some extent passed his怨言也到宝玉的丫头们身上, the current victim of their wrath was most likely Bao-yu.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Fortunately, Lady Feng was in the main hall calculating the gambling debts, when she heard a loud commotion from the back. She immediately realized that it was due to Mrs. Li's old age and illness flaring up, and coinciding with her losing money today, which led her to take out her anger on someone, specifically targeting the servant girl who had provoked Baiyu.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Xue-yin's arrival created a flutter of activity on the upper floor, where Xi-feng was at that moment sitting with the other women balancing the accounts for the day. Hearing a loud commotion from the lower floor, she knew at once that Nannie Li must have relapsed and, having lost money earlier in the day, be taking it out on some innocent maid.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The text translates to: "As the clever Phoenix Sister was counting the winnings and losses, she heard a commotion behind her and knew that Li's grandmother was ill and had lost money. She became angry and scolded the maid of honor."
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: It happened that Xi-feng was in her upper room, going over the day's winnings and losses with her steward, when she heard a sudden commotion in the apartment below. Knowing at once that Nannie Li had set the servants at each other's throats again after losing at cards - for she had herself been the principal loser that day - she hurried down to interfere.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Sister Qiao Phoenix is settling the winning and losing accounts in her room when she hears a commotion from behind. She realizes that Auntie Li is ill again, and since she has lost money today, she is angry with the people. She scolds the maid, Pearl.

Xi-feng was in the upper room counting her winnings from the afternoon's play when the sudden commotion in the room below showed that Nannie Li had arrived. She stopped counting, and waited with interest to see what would happen next.

chinese: 家中虽不甚富贵，然本地也推他为望族了。
english: The household was not a particularly wealthy one, but they were nevertheless looked up to by all and sundry as the leading family in the neighbourhood.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: While home may not be very rich, his local has made him a wealthy family.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Although, generally speaking, his family was not very wealthy, he felt that he was a member of the elite.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Though not very wealthy, he is regarded as a noble family in his home town.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Though they were by no means rich, everywhere in the area they were regarded as a prosperous family.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Although my family was not exceedingly wealthy, they were considered a distinguished clan in the local area.

chinese: 它压倒了薄荷的幽香，压倒了高粱的甘苦，它唤醒了父亲那越来越迫近的记忆，一线穿珠般地把墨水河淤泥、把高粱下黑土、把永远死不了的过去和永远留不住的现在联系在一起，有时候，万物都会吐出人血的味道。
english: It overwhelmed the smell of peppermint and the pungent sweetness of sorghum and awakened in Father's mind a memory that drew ever nearer: like beads, it strung together the mud of the Black Water River, the black earth beneath the sorghum, the eternally living past, and the unstoppable present. There are times when everything on earth spits out the stench of human blood.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: It overwhelmed the faint perfume of mint, the sweet taste of high粱， it awakened the father who was becoming closer to his memories, one line like a thread that links the mud from the riverbed of ink, the black soil below which he had buried forever dead, and the now-forever lost present and future together. Sometimes, everything would pour out the scent of human blood.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It swallowed the sweet smells of peppermint, the bitter滋味， and as it did so, it brought up the memory of a blood-stained riverbank, as if every moment was but the close approach of an eternal death. Sometimes the earth even smelled of human blood.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: It overpowered the minty freshness, the cornicelli bitterness, and it awakened my father's memories that were getting closer and closer; a line of beads connecting ink river silt, black earth under high-rice stalks, and the past that would never die and the present that could not be held back; sometimes, all things give off the smell of human blood.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It suppressed the sweet fragrance of peppermint, and the pungent aroma of sorghum. It awakened memories that had seemed forgotten, as though a string of beads was sewn together to link the muddy Black Water River bed with the dark earth of the sorghum field and the past, which continues to leak out of its graves; at times, one could smell the bloody blood of deceased beings.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: It overwhelmed the mint's subtle fragrance and the sweetness of sorghum's bitterness. It awakened the father's increasingly pressing memories, linking the muddied waters of the Ink River with the dark soil under the sorghum, tying together the past that never dies with the present that can never be held back. Sometimes, all things can emit the taste of human blood.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The odour of garlic overwhelmed the cool fragrance of peppermint and the sweet bitterness of sorghum, awakening memories so vividly connected to the past that at times they blended indistinguishably with the present.

chinese: 外又有各同窗家中分资，也凑了二三十两。
english: A collection made among the parents of the dead man's fellow-students raised an additional twenty or thirty taels.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: And there were also some of their fellow students who had contributed money from home as well.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Extra money came in the shape of the contributions made by his classmates at other schools.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: There was also some of the classmates' money from their homes, which they had pooled together and put in for about twenty or thirty pieces.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Other than that, however, Yu-cun relied on income from his studies: a monthly stipend from his home university, and about twenty dollars a year from his classmates as roommates. All together they had managed to accumulate a quarter of a hundred.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: In addition, there were contributions from various fellow students' families, adding up to around twenty to thirty taels of silver.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): In addition to this he shared in the annual scholarships awarded to each student by his parents, which amounted to another twenty or thirty taels.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Outside, there were also people from different families who contributed some money, amounting to several tens of dollars.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: And besides that, each of his triads had contributed something, so that in all they raised between them fifteen or twenty taels of silver.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Inside, there are also some fellow villagers pooling resources, and they gathered around thirty taels.
Besides this, he had a number of loans outstanding to various people in the village, amounting in all to between twenty and thirty taels.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): That Whiskers Whiskers Mao is not your father.'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Mao十八, son of the Mao family, is not your father?"

chinese: 轿子走到平川旷野，轿夫们便撒了野，这一是为了赶路，二是要折腾一下新娘。
english: When the sedan chair reached the plains, the bearers began to get a little sloppy, both to make up time and to torment their passenger.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The carriage reached a valley, and the driver spread his legs, for it was to get away from the bridegroom and to do some messing around with her.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As the sedan chair arrived at a scenic vista, it was time for a bit of levitation; one purpose was to take the bride away from the onslaught of the storm, and the other was to regroup.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The carriage rolled across the flat, open plains, and the men of the groom's household took advantage of it by letting loose. They did so for two reasons: one was that they wanted to get their bride out of the way; the other was to take a bit of joy out of her.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As the sedan chair approached level ground and a wide expanse of empty land, the bearers let their imaginations run wild, one for chasing his new wife, the other for simply riling her up.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: When the sedan chair reached the flat plains, the bearers let loose, both to hasten their journey and to tease the bride a bit.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): When they were in the wide open plain, the bearers would let themselves go, both because they needed to keep up the pace and because they could now torment the bride.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The sedan chair was carried to the vast open plain, and the sedan bearers scattered some wild grass. This was to speed up their journey and to play around with the new bride.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: By the time they reached the flat plain, the bearers were through being careful and wanted to tease the bride a bit.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The carriage arrived at the vast plains of Pingchuan, and the coachmen immediately let the horses run free, for one reason to hurry on the journey, and for another to give the new bride a bit of excitement.
When they reached the wide, open plain, the bearers lowered the sedan chair to the ground, a action intended to speed up the journey and at the same time to give the bride a taste of what lay ahead.

chinese: 所得的好处是比别人早回城，但是早回来没什么好，还得到京郊插队。
english: One benefit I got was that I returned to the city earlier than the other city students. But what was the good of returning earlier? I still had to be reeducated in the countryside near Beijing.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The benefits accrue sooner than others, but it is not worth getting back to town until you get into the countryside for a week or so.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The benefits were that they could return to the city early and could even go down to the mountains to serve in the countryside until their comrades came back.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The advantage of getting there early is that one gets back home earlier, but it's not a good thing to get back home earlier. One has to go to the countryside outside Beijing.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The advantage to me was that I got to go back earlier than others; but since I didn't like to go back, I had to be sent down to the countryside for our team.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The benefit is getting back to the city earlier than others, but coming back early isn't good, it means you have to go to the suburbs of the capital and be sent to work in the countryside there.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The advantage was that she could return to the city earlier, but coming back to the city wasn't good, because she had to go down to the countryside to 're-educate' herself.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The benefit of getting home early is that you beat the crowd, but coming back early doesn't have any good things, and you get stuck in the suburbs.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The advantage she got was that she got to go back to the city first of anyone else, but then she had to go back to the countryside on a mission.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The advantage is returning to the city earlier than others, but coming back early doesn't have much benefit, and there is still a need to queue in the suburbs.
The advantage of returning early was that one got back to the city sooner, but the disadvantage was that one had to spend the last part of the journey in a crowded cart.

chinese: 海老公叹道：“眼睛瞧不见，药是不能乱服的了。”
english: Again the old man sighed. 'I've already lost my eyesight. Medicine has to be taken in the proper doses.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: He said, "I can’t see what’s going on with my eyes, so I can’t take any pills without consulting a doctor."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Old Hai heaved a surprised sigh. 'Sorry, your eyes are not capable of viewing it.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Haiyinwang said, "If I can't see with my eyes, I cannot take medicine carelessly."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Old Hai heaved a strangely unconcerned sigh. 'You can't just take any old medicine when you've lost the sight - it's not that easy.'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The Sea Grandpa sighed, "If you can't see with your eyes, medicines should not be taken randomly."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The old eunuch heaved a sigh. 'So I suppose I'd better stay away from any medicines then.'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The old man said, "I can't take the medicine without seeing it."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Old Hai heaved a disconsolate sigh. 'If your eyes have gone and you take the medicine, it will do you no good and may do you a lot of harm.'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The crab exclaimed: "Eyes can't see, medicine should not be taken randomly."
Well, I can't see out of my eyes,' said the old eunuch, 'so I can't take just any old medicine.'

chinese: 在一声刺耳的破裂声后，“审判日”号的船尾一侧出现了一个破洞，这洞是被一个巨大的金属构件撞出的。

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Just when it looked like the ship wouldn't break free, the sounds of alarm caused a crack in the front port hull, and a large steel piece smashed through the hole to release the ship.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): After a刺耳的破裂声响起, Judgment Day began to reveal a skiff of metal tearing through the ship's hull.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Following a piercing crack, a hole appeared on one side of the "Day of Judgment" ship's stern. The hole was created by a massive metal structure.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Followed by a loud crack, a hole appeared on one side of the stern of Judgment Day. The hole was drilled by a giant metal object.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: After the deafening crash, a large metal object collided with the stern of the "Judgment Day" ship, creating a hole on the port side.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Following a loud crack, a hole appeared on the side of Judgment Day. The hole was made by a large metal object.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: After a deafening cracking sound, a hole appeared on the starboard side of the "Judgment Day" ship, this hole was caused by a large metal component.

chinese: 韦小宝伸出了舌头，半天缩不进去，随即喜欢得心痒难搔，笑道：“我一定不做坏事。
english: Trinket stuck his tongue out in amazement and it was some time before he could put it back in again. Yet his overriding feeling was not of amazement but of happiness that he had got this heroic strong man for his teacher. 'I promise you I won't ever do anything bad,' he said.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaobang stretched out his tongue for a long time before he couldn’t get it in. Then, after enjoying himself too much, he said with delight, “I’ll definitely not do anything bad.”
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket finally got his tongue back in his mouth, but even after he had done that he was still so bored that he might have let it lie. 'Oh, I shouldn't do anything silly, Goong-goong!
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaolong reached out his tongue, and it didn’t go in for a long time. He then liked the feeling of it itching him so much that he laughed and said, "I will definitely not do evil."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It was some minutes before Trinket's tongue reached his mouth again, but once it was inside, he wanted to slip it all the way down.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Wei Xiaobao stuck out his tongue, but couldn't pull it back for a long time. He then felt delighted to the point of being unable to resist, smiling as he said, "I will definitely not do anything bad."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket stuck out his tongue, then drew it in again rather shyly. But then he started grinning. 'I promise, Goong-goong! I promise!
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "I won't do anything bad."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Trinket stuck his tongue out, and since it was stuck out, he felt so ticklish that he almost laughed out loud. 'I'll never be bad again,' he vowed.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Wei Xiaobao extended his tongue, it couldn't retract for half a day, and then he itched all over with pleasure, and said: "I definitely won't do bad things."
Trinket extended his tongue but could not get it into his mouth. The result was a ticklish sensation in his heart which made him giggle. 'I wouldn't want to do anything bad, ' he said.

chinese: 其实在一般女学生看来，能为导演看上去试一回，已是足够的光荣，成功则是奢望中的奢望。
english: Actually, just to be chosen by a director for a screen test would already have been a great honor in the eyes of most girls—any hopes of getting a part would be a long shot in a long shot.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Success is simply a dream that cannot be achieved.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Under normal circumstances, girls would have given a director a try; that itself is enough to make the girl feel accomplished. But being successful is more than most girls want; they yearn for it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: For the average female student, it is enough that she can appear before a director and try her luck once; success would be a luxury beyond reach.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): To the average girl student, just to get invited for a screen test was a honor. Success, coming on top of a favorable reaction, was the stuff of fantasy.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: In fact, from the perspective of most female students, it is already a great honor just to have the chance to try out for a director. Success is merely a fantasy within fantasies for them.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): In the eyes of most girls, simply having a director look at them while they tested would have been enough glory, never mind the hope of success.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: In general, being noticed by a director and getting a chance to audition is already an honor for most female students. To succeed in the industry is a luxury beyond their wildest dreams.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: In the opinion of most female students, just being noticed by a director was glory enough; but to be in a film was a luxurious dream.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: In general, for a female student, just having the opportunity to audition for a director is already a great honor. If successful, it would be a dream come true.

To be called on by the director for a screen test was, in the eyes of most female students, a distinction sufficient to make them happy; to actually succeed would have seemed almost too good to be true.

chinese: 韦小宝应道：“是！” 心中却说：“我做半件坏事，却又如何？”
english: 'No, sir,' said Trinket; but a rebellious little voice inside him was saying, 'What about half a bad thing?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Qian Baogang replied, "Yes!" His heart said, "I did a half-dozen wrongs, but how?"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I know,' said Trinket. But behind him was a voice in his mind: 'Well now I've done one good thing and then done something really bad... What the hell am I trying to achieve?'

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I can do that,' thought Trinket, 'can't very well refuse.'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Very well!" replied Wei Xiaobao, though inwardly he was thinking, "But what if I do half a bad deed?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Yes, sir,' said Trinket. But it was 'Yes, goong-goong', thought Trinket, 'what's so terrible about doing a little bad thing?'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "I'll do it!" But inside, he thought, "How can I do something bad?"</s>

english: They wanted me to confess how I had slipped across the border.

chinese: 这件事有两种可能的原因，一是他下来视察，遇见了我对他装聋作哑，因而大怒，不走了。 二是他不是下来视察，而是听说陈清扬和我有了一腿，特地来找我的麻烦。
english: His visit could be accounted for in two ways: one was that he came down to our team for the investigation, but when he met someone like me who played dumb with him, he got pissed off and decided to stay; the other was that he came down to our team not for investigation, but to pick on me, after hearing that Chen Qingyang and I had a love affair.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: There are two possible explanations for this matter. One is that he came down to inspect me, and he had him on his hands and knees, so he was extremely angry. He did not go any further. The other explanation is that he did not come down to inspect, but heard of our relationship with Chen Qingyu and found it a little bit strange.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There were two possible causes for this: one was that he had come down to see me after he heard my response, and met with my silence and slowness in response, which caused him great anger and ended the both' s career. The other possibility was that he wasn't actually here but some other wayward brother of his, who had heard of my relationship with Chen Qingyang and came to trouble me.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: There are two possible reasons for this, one is that he came down to inspect and saw me being deaf and dumb, so he was furious and left. The other possibility is that he did not come down to inspect but heard that Chen Qingyang had been having a fling with me and came to trouble me specifically.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There could be two possible explanations for why he might have left: either he had come down to investigate and found me covering my ears, or he wasn't there to investigate but was after Chen Qingyang and me.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: There are two possible reasons for this. One is that he came down to inspect and happened upon me ignoring him, which made him so angry that he refused to leave. The other possibility is that he did not come for a routine inspection but heard about the relationship between Chen Qingyang and myself and came specifically to cause trouble.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): There were only two explanations for his behavior. One was that he came down for a inspection, saw me ignoring him and got angry; or the other was that he hadn't come for an inspection, but heard that Chen Qingyang had taken me as her lover, and came to make my life miserable.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: This incident could have two reasons. One possibility is that he came to check on me and encountered me pretending to be deaf and mute, which made him very angry and he did not go. The other possibility is that he did not come to check on me but heard that Chen Qingyang and I had an affair, so he came specifically to cause trouble for me.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: There might have been two reasons for his visit. One was that he came to investigate the matter and, having met me, got angry because I was pretending to be deaf and dumb; the other was that he didn't come to investigate but heard that Chen Qingyang and I had become a couple and came to give me trouble.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: This event has two possible reasons. One is that he came to inspect and met me pretending to be deaf and mute, which made him angry and left. The other is that he did not come to inspect, but heard that Chen Qingyang and I have a leg problem, and came specifically to bother me about it.

There were two possibilities as to why he came. One was that he had come to check on me, found me feigning deafness and mute, and got really angry and left; or two, he hadn't come to check on me but had heard that Chen Qingyang and I now had a third leg between us and had come to see what the trouble was.

gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Cherish the tender and laugh at you foolishly, orchid blooms empty against the snow.
I have always been a silly old fool, but you are the one who is really in love with laughter.

chinese: 他们杀人越货，精忠报国，他们演出过一幕幕英勇悲壮的舞剧，使我们这些活着的不肖子孙相形见绌，在进步的同时，我真切地感到种的退化。
english: They killed, they looted, and they defended their country in a valiant, stirring ballet that makes us unfilial descendants who now occupy the land pale by comparison. Surrounded by progress, I feel a nagging sense of our species' regression.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: They kill and loot, sacrifice their lives for righteousness, they have performed a chorus of dramatic operas, which made us all look like fools while we were advancing, I truly felt that our moral decay.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): During his lifetime he committed no less than a dozen crimes: his heroism and fidelity combined to make a sacred contribution to the ballet of death in which he performed scenes with a passionate beauty of emotion. ' These killers they performed before our living子孙 as prodigiously as well as inspiring ones, so that we these dead sons of tears have the distinct impression that our progeny is deteriorating ourselves.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: They killed and looted, they were chivalrous, they were patriotic, they performed a series of heroic tragedies that made us living descendants look inferior, while at the same time I felt a sense of decline.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): They murderers and robbers, but they performed dramas of valour and beauty that made us who we aren't. As I grew older, I felt stronger empathy for the peasants, and my sense of loss grew stronger.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: They committed murder for loot, showing their loyalty and devotion to their country. They performed heroic and tragic ballets that make us, their unexceptional descendants still alive, seem pale by comparison. As we advance, I truly feel a sense of degeneration within our species.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): They committed crimes and committed suicide to further their cause; they performed heroically in films that made us, his unworthy descendants, seem pale in comparison. Progress has made me feel degenerate.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: They killed people and carried out the national mission, performing a magnificent and heroic play that made us feel ashamed of our ancestors' degeneration. While we are alive, we should strive to progress and improve ourselves.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Those heroes who killed to rob and traitors who loyalized—they all performed their roles with distinction on that stage. And there, right before our very eyes, we saw the decline of our own children and grandchildren. Yet even in decline, we progressed.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: They are more ruthless in killing, more loyal in serving the country, they have staged many brave and grand dramas, which makes us, the unworthy descendants, feel ashamed, as we progress, I truly feel the degeneration.

They would say that their devotion to the revolution had driven them to murder, and that it was the only way to repay the country for its trust. They once performed a grand and heroic drama for us, making us, the survivors, feel ashamed of our own species. As the revolution marched forward, I felt the degeneration of our kind.

chinese: 韦小宝应了，走进房中，只见桌上放着碗筷，四菜一汤，没人动过，忙道：“公公，你不吃饭？
english: 'Yes, Goong-goong!' Trinket walked across to the dining-table, where bowls and chopsticks had been laid, four dishes and a soup, all untouched. 'Goong-goong, aren't you eating?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wu Zai Ba went in, and saw a bowl on the table. There were four dishes, one soup and two stews, none of them had been eaten by anyone. He said, "Sir, you don’t eat?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket responded promptly and followed him into the room. To his amazement, there was barely anything on the table: rice, soup, two small dishes, and a few chopsticks, except that there seemed to have been no food taken by the two of them at all. 'Goong-goong, you're the only one left,' he said. 'Nothing's gone to the kitchen anyway, which means... oh well, I'm afraid that means you've got nothing to eat.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaoya nodded and entered the room. He saw that there were bowls and chopsticks on the table, four dishes with one bowl of soup, no one had touched them. He hurriedly said, "Grandfather, don't you want to eat?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket went in after. There was now, however, a table and utensils laid out and four distinct dishes with their respective sauces were placed on top of the table, indicating that supper had been prepared but nobody seemed to have touched it. Trinket hurriedly asked: 'Goong-goong, don't you feel like eating?
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Vie Huatiao replied, walked into the room, and saw that there were chopsticks on the table, four dishes and a bowl of soup, none of which had been touched. He hurriedly said, "Grandfather, you aren't eating?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket went into the room and saw that there was a bowl of rice on the table already, with four dishes and a soup on it. None of the dishes had been touched. 'Butcher, you haven't eaten yet, have you?
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Weixiao Bao responded and entered the room, only to find a bowl of chopsticks and four dishes of food that no one had touched. He exclaimed, "Grandpa, didn't you eat?"</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Trinket hurried over to the table. There was enough for four people: two different vegetables and a soup. Neither of the two gentlemen at the table was eating, although the food had clearly not been touched. 'Shouldn't you be eating, Goong-goong,'he said.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Wei XiaoBao nodded, walked into the room, and saw a bowl and chopsticks on the table, with four dishes and a soup, untouched. He asked urgently: "Grandpa, didn't you eat your meal?"

Trinket followed him into the room. There was a table laid out with plates and chopsticks on which a simple meal of four dishes and a soup was laid, but the old eunuch appeared not to have touched it. 'Goong-goong,' he said, 'you didn't eat your dinner?

chinese: 半日鸦雀不闻。 忽见两个人抬了一张炕桌来，放在这边炕上，桌上碗盘摆列，仍是满满的鱼肉，不过略动了几样。
english: A long silence ensued in which not so much as a cheep could be heard; then two women came in bearing a small, low table which they set down on the kang. It was covered with bowls and dishes containing all kinds of meat and fish, only one or two of which appeared to have been touched.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Half a day, they did not hear any noise. Suddenly, two people came with a table on one side of the炕, placed it there, and placed their dishes on it. But the food was still filled with fish and meat. But they moved a few things.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): After some hesitation he heard a sound which, though not distinct, appeared to come from inside. Some moment afterwards the same sort of sounds arose, but this time there were two figures搬了张餐桌过来，放在一边炕上。 Inside it were bowls and plates already laid out, but barely any fish or meat at all.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: There was silence for half a day. Then, two men came with a bed table and placed it on this side of the bed. The bowls and dishes were still full of fish and meat, but they had been moved around a little.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Quietly quiet were the streets until half way through, when two figures began moving around among the villagers' belongings and set down a meal on the floor between them. The only changes made to this already changed dish were a few little moves here and there.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: For half a day, there was no sound. Suddenly, I saw two people carrying a table and placing it on this side of the炕 (bed), with dishes and bowls arranged neatly, still full of fish and meat, though a few items had been moved around slightly.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): There was no further sign of activity for some minutes, when two servants came in carrying a small table which they set down on the kang to the side of him. On this table were dishes of meat and fish, the plates round with barely a chopstick's breadth of space between them.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Half a day passed and I didn't hear a peep. Suddenly, I saw two people carrying a table over here and placing it on the bed. The dishes and bowls were arranged on the table, and although they had moved a few things around, it was still full of fish meat.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: No word was heard all day, when suddenly two bearers came along carrying a dining-table, which they set down on our kang, and laid out a variety of choice dishes of meat, apparently recently eaten, each article of plate and chopstick showing a slight trace of use.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Half a day without a peep from the sparrows. Suddenly, two people carried in a low table and placed it here on the bed, with bowls and plates neatly arranged on the table, still filled with fish meat, although a few items had been slightly depleted.
After a while the cry of 'Fish!' was heard no more, but after a while longer two men came in and placed a table with its dishes of rice and curry on the kang at the head of the room.
