chinese: 理发店门前的三色灯柱旋转着，也是夜景不熄的内心。
english: The tricolor revolving pole outside the barbershop was the emblem of this unsleeping city.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Three colors of lamps on the roadside rotate, illuminating their own inner light.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The colors on the reception tables of hair saloons rotated, reflecting the night skyline as effortlessly as a natural wonder.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The three-color lamp posts at the entrance of the barber shop rotate, and they also light up the night scene in their hearts.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The three-color light columns in front of the barber shop rotate, giving the appearance that even when the city is without lights, the heart of Shanghai never sleeps.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The tri-colored lantern poles outside the barber shop spin, also the unending inner glow of the night scene.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The three-coloured lights outside the barber shop spin, never turning off.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The three-colored lamp post in front of the barber shop is rotating, and it's the inner light that never goes out at night.

chinese: 此方人家俱用竹篱木壁，也是劫数应当如此，于是接二连三牵五挂四，将一条街烧得如火焰山一般；彼时虽有军民来救，那火已成了势了，如何救得下? 直烧了一夜方息，也不知烧了多少人家。
english: And, since the houses in this area all had wooden walls and bamboo fences—though also, doubtless, because they were doomed to destruction anyway-the fire leaped from house to house until the whole street was blazing away like a regular Fiery Mountain; and though the firemen came to put it out, by the time they arrived the fire was well under way and long past controlling, and roared away all night long until it had burnt itself out, rendering heaven knows how many families homeless in the process.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: This house is made of bamboo walls and wood fences, too. It's fitting that this should happen, so it was followed by a series of steps: cutting off two, then cutting off five, then cutting off four, all at once, and setting fire to the street like a hot mountain. At that time, even though there were civilians who came to help, the fire had already reached its peak, how could they save it down? They burned for one night before it died down. Could they have burnt more than half a dozen homes?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): This area of town, therefore, had built itself up under the duress of the Balcones and the Bamboo Scales, with which this city of merchants and brothels had agreed to build its buildings, having suffered a series of arson attempts starting spontaneously from the hoarded fire-wood supplied by the soldiers and civilians on their way from the streets. At first the military leaders believed that the townspeople would be able to burn their houses themselves, but after another few hours the大火已经施于人间的性质, and no one could devise a way through it to extinguish it; hence the night was spent in waiting for the night army to come and rescue them. Not until morning did anyone find out how many houses had been burned.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: This family had furniture made of bamboo and wood, and it was meant that this should be the way things would go, so they continued to burn houses like a burning mountain; even then, when there were soldiers and civilians coming to save them, how could they put out the fire? It burned all night long, and they did not know how many houses were burnt.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Every family in this neighborhood uses thatching and pole-walls for their doors and gates, so it follows that in this sort of place like the one we live in there must be as many Revelations as there are houses, and soon a chain of fires, beginning at one end and ending at the other, ensues, burning down一条街道就像一座火焰山一样。 At least once in the course of the night the firefighters were able to bring it under control; but how many households had been destroyed in all?
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: In this neighborhood, every household used bamboo fences and wooden walls. It was as if it was their fate to be like this. As a result, one after another, they strung out like a chain, setting fire to the entire street, making it resemble a mountain of flames. Even though soldiers and civilians came to save it at that time, the fire had already gained momentum; how could they save it? The fire burned for an entire night before it finally subsided, and no one knew how many homes were destroyed.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): In this district people used bamboo fences and wooden walls, and it seemed fated that sooner or later they should all be burnt down, for, following one another in quick succession, those fires had turned a long stretch of street into a great fiery mountain, so that, though troops and civilians came rushing round to help to put them out, by the time they arrived the fires had already got started and there was no putting them out any more. They continued burning for a whole night, and when at last they died down, it was estimated that more than one hundred and fifty homes had been destroyed.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: This family uses bamboo fences and wooden walls, which is inevitable during a calamity. As a result, one street was set on fire and became like a mountain of flames. Even though the soldiers and civilians came to help, it was too late to save the situation. The fire burned for an entire night and destroyed many homes.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The walls and hedges of bamboo and wooden partitions marking out the different quarters were set alight, and the great wall enclosing the city followed suit, until the whole street was one ball of fire. By the time the troops and the people came rushing to the rescue, the conflagration was already out of control and the firemen were powerless to stop it. It raged for a whole night, destroying countless houses and driving out their inhabitants.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-:
This method is using bamboo fence and wooden wall, it should be like this in a raid, so they pulled two and connected three, hung four, and set a whole street on fire, like a mountain of fire flames; at that time, there were soldiers and civilians coming to rescue, but the fire had already gained momentum, how could they rescue it? It took a night to extinguish, and it was unknown how many houses were burned down.

Translation: This method used bamboo fences and wooden walls, as it should be in a raid. They connected two, pulled three, hung four, and set a whole street on fire, resembling a mountain of fire flames. Although soldiers and civilians came to rescue, the fire had already gained momentum. It took a night to extinguish, and it was unknown how many houses were burned down.

The inhabitants of that quarter all used bamboo and wood for walls, and since robbery is a matter of technique, it is not surprising that they should have been unable to withstand the onslaught. By the time the military deputy and the villagers arrived, the fire was already out of control and there seemed to be no hope of saving the quarter. It was not until the following morning, after the fire had burned itself out, that the extent of the damage became apparent.

chinese: 叶哲泰的妻子，同系的物理学教授绍琳从台下的前排站起来，走上台。 她身穿一件很不合体的草绿色衣服，显然想与红卫兵的色彩拉近距离，但熟悉绍琳的人联想到以前常穿精致旗袍讲课的她，总觉得别扭。
english: Ye's wife, physics professor Shao Lin, stood up from the crowd's front row. She walked onto the stage dressed in an ill-fitting green outfit, clearly intended to imitate the military uniform of the Red Guards. Those who knew her remembered that she had often taught class in an elegant qipao, and her current appearance felt forced and awkward.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The wife of Professor Chiang Yee-chun, who is also a physics professor from the same department as Prof. Lin, stood up from her seat behind the podium, making her way to the stage. She was wearing a very loose-fitting green dress that didn’t match her usual attire, but she noticed how similar it seemed to the dress she had worn previously when lecturing in a refined and elegant manner.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Shao Lin, the physics professor in the后排，站立了起来，也走上台。和叶哲泰一样，她身着一件不合时式的草绿色服装，试图将自己与前来造反的青年们的关系拉近。叶哲泰的朋友熟悉她这段日子总穿着合身旗袍上课的情景，觉得这一点不如就该提起来。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Ye Zhetai’s wife, associate professor Xiao Lin rose up from the back row of the audience and walked up on stage. She wore a very unflattering green dress that was obviously intended to be close to the red guard colors, but people who were familiar with Xiao Lin could not help but feel uncomfortable when they thought of how often she used to wear fine silk dresses while lecturing.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): When Ye's wife, Professor Shao Lin, stood up from the台下前排，走向台前，身穿一件明显过大的草绿色衣服，有人看着她不禁想起了过去她经常穿着精致旗袍上课的形象。
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Ye Zhetai's wife, Professor Shaolin from the same department, stood up from the front row in the audience and walked onto the stage. She was wearing a very ill-fitting olive-green dress, clearly trying to match the colors of the Red Guards, but those familiar with her always felt it was awkward, given that she had previously often worn elegant cheongsams when lecturing.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Ye's wife, So Lin, a physics professor at the school, got up from the front row of the audience, wearing a camouflaged shirt that was too big for her, as if trying to blend in with the red guards. But Ye, who knew her well, could not help feeling that something was wrong under all that fabric, recalling how she used to wear a traditional Chinese skirt, called a cheongsam, when she taught.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The wife of Professor Ye Zhetai, Shao Lin, stood up from her seat in the front row and walked onto the stage. She was wearing a green dress that was not very flattering, and it seemed she was trying to blend in with the red guard's colors. However, those familiar with Shao Lin's usual attire of elegant cheongsams while lecturing felt a bit awkward.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Ye's wife, Professor Shao Lin, rose from her seat in the first row and came onto the stage. She was wearing a green dress that didn't fit her well at all, clearly trying to show solidarity with the Red Guards. But people who knew her well remembered the sharp green Chinese dress she used to wear when she taught, and it seemed awkward to see her in anything other than that.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Zhe Zhe Tai's wife, fellow physics professor Xiaoling Shao, stands up from the lower seats in the front row and walks onto the stage. She is wearing a very mismatched green dress, apparently trying to get closer to the color scheme of the Red Guards, but familiar people often think of her who used to wear elegant gowns to lecture, always feel awkward.

Ye Zhetai's wife, Shao Lin, a physics professor, rose from the front row of the audience and walked up onto the stage. She was wearing a green suit, obviously trying to coordinate with the Red Guards' colors, but familiar sartorial choices of Shao Lin's made the audience uncomfortable; they remembered her as a professor who used to give lectures in a beautiful cheongsam.

chinese: 刘老老便拉住一个道：“我问哥儿一声：有个周大娘在家么？”
english: She grabbed a small urchin from their midst and drew him towards her. 'Tell me, sonny, is there a Mrs Zhou living here?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Tang Yonglong seized him by the shoulder and said, “I asked Brother Liang: Is there a woman named Wangma at home?”
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Grannie Liu took hold of him warmly and held on: 'What about Miss Zhou? Is she at home?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Liu's old man grabbed at one of the men and said, "I want to ask my brother: is there a Zhou Da-ma at home?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Grannie Liu抓住其中一个女人的衣袖: 'I was wondering if there's a lady called Zhou who lives here?'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The Old Mr. Liu then grabbed one of them and asked, "Excuse me, young man: is there a Madam Zhou at home?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Grannie Liu separated herself from one of them. 'I was wondering if I could trouble one of you to tell me if there's a Mrs Zhou at home?'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Did you ask your brother if there's an old lady named Zhou at home?"</s>

chinese: 只是他为人稳重谨慎，既不落款，亦无题跋。
english: 'But you know what a stolid, careful person Erzhan is. He wouldn't sign it and he wouldn't write any inscription.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Only he is modest and careful, without a signature or a dedication.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But he was a cautious man, and without a signature or title, no gilding was needed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He was just a man of great reserve and caution, not signing his name nor adding any notes or annotations.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): However, since not a trace of inscription or signature was to be found on these pages, Old Colour's reasoning seemed the more sound, for it must have been an embarrassment if the man had wished to leave his name on them.

unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: He is a cautious and serious person who avoids being ostentatious and does not sign his name.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: But because he was a steady and cautious man, he never allowed himself to be persuaded to do anything unworthy, and never wrote his name down on a subscription list for any publication he did not intend to support.

chinese: 等王琦瑶最终拗不过她，答应换个日子再去的时候，吴佩珍便像又受了一次恩，欢天喜地去找表哥改日子。
english: By the time Wang Qiyao finally gave in and agreed to go some other time, Wu Peizhen was acting as if yet another gift that she herself had to be thankful for had been bestowed upon her, and she ecstatically scurried off to find her cousin to change the date.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Eventually, Wang Qiu'er gave in to her, agreeing to a different date when she finally had enough of his persistence. Gu Pingjing was delighted to find out that she had been given another chance to change her mind about the day's schedule.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): When Wang Qiyao finally got herself to change her mind, this time on a suitable day, Wu Peizhen's mood would immediately improve when she learned that she'd been given another ride. She went off to make the appointment with her cousin and found herself laughing and gurgling happy grounds.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: When Wang Qiyue finally could not resist her, and agreed to come again on another day, Wu Peizhen was like receiving a second kindness. She went to find her cousin to change the date.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Having finally convinced Wang Qiyao to agree to another day, Wu Peizhen, like a true grateful host, went to ask her cousin to change the date.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: When Wang Qiyao finally gave in and agreed to go another day, Wu Peizhen was as elated as if she had received a favor anew, and she cheerfully went to find her cousin to change the date.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Eventually, unable to withstand her pressure, Wang Qiyao agreed to reschedule the appointment for another day, whereupon Wu Peizhen immediately went off to tell her cousin about the good news and their joyful mission.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: When King Qi-yao finally gave in and agreed to go another day, Wu Pei-chen was overjoyed like she had received a second blessing and happily went to find her brother to change the date.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: When Wang Qiyao finally gave in to Wu Peizhen's requests and agreed to go, she felt obligated to go out of a sense of gratitude, and she went to her cousin's place to make the date.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Wang Jiaoyao finally couldn't resist her. She agreed to change the date and go there another time. After that, Wu Peizhen was like receiving another favor, and she happily went to find her brother to change the date.

chinese: 大史说：“震荡炸弹是我们警方用的玩意儿，确实可以一下子把建筑物里的人震昏，但目前好像只对一两个房间有用。
english: Da Shi said, 'I use concussion bombs in police work, but they're toys. They're indeed capable of stunning people inside a building into unconsciousness, but they're only good for a room or two.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Da Shi explained, 'The炸弹只是一个普通的武器,不能使人昏迷。目前看来,只能对其中的一两间建筑使用。

unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Big History said, "Shaking bombs are what we police use; they can indeed knock people out in buildings, but currently it seems they're only effective for one or two rooms."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Da Shi said, 'Explosive震荡 bombs are what we cops use, and they can indeed paralyze the people inside a building. But right now we can only get one or two rooms with them.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The big boss said: "The shock bomb is something we use for our operations. It can definitely stun people inside the building, but it only seems to be effective in two rooms right now."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: 'Daan bomb?' said Da Shi. 'That's what we cops use. It can stun everyone inside a building, but right now it only seems to work on one or two rooms at a time.

Earthquake bombs are what our public security people use,' said Da Shi. 'They can stun everyone in a room with one blast. But right now they seem to only work in one or two of the rooms.

chinese: 如今王府虽升了官儿，只怕二姑太太还认的咱们，你为什么不走动走动?

chinese: 平安里的一日生计，是在喧嚣之中拉开帷幕；粪车的轱辘声，涮马桶声，几十个煤球炉子在弄堂里升烟，隔夜洗的衣衫也晾出来了，竹竿交错，好像在烟幕中升旗。
english: Mornings, however, begin with night-soil carts, clattering in to collect waste for fertilizer, and the raspy noises of brushes scrubbing out commodes. Amid the smoke of coal burners, laundry soaked overnight is taken out to be hung, banner-like, on bamboo poles.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The daily life of a village is one that begins in noise; the grinding wheel’s clatter and the dripping toilet water pour down the streets as coal-burning stoves in the alleyways rise smoke, and clothes that had been hung out for the night also come out of the washers.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The day begins with the frenzied sounds of a garbage truck, speckled by沸羊油飞沫, as dozens of fuel-stove grates within Chinese longtang rise up as well, releasing the clothes that have been hung over night; among them is a good deal of the evening's worn-out clothing. The alleluia of torches and sticks symbolically raises the flag for new days.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: A day's life at the Ping'an Street is a curtain that is raised amidst the din; the grinding of the horse-drawn cart, the clatter of the toilet bowl, the sound of dozens of coal-burning stoves in the alley, and the overnight laundry hanging out on the clothesline, all seem to be rising flags in the smoke.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The life they led in Peace Lane was enacted out under the cover of darkness. The braying of the donkey cart wheels and the flushing of the manholes were accompanied by the rising smoke of a dozen or so coals, as if they were raising the flag at dawn in a遮羞雾。
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The daily routine in Peace Lane unfolds amidst the din; the sound of the dung cart's wheels, the flushing of toilets, dozens of coal stove chimneys puffing smoke, and laundry from last night hung out to dry, creating a scene where bamboo poles cross like flags in the haze.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The day in Peace Lane begins with the garbage truck's wobbly wheels and the sounds of people brushing the scales off the toilets, followed by the ring-ring-ring of stovetop kettles. Night's laundry hangs out to dry, blocking off the alley like battle standards.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The daily routine in Ping'an Village is carried out amidst the hustle and bustle. The sound of the cart's wheels and bucket scooping water, as well as the smoke from the coal balls stoves in the courtyard, can be heard. The clothes that were washed at night have been hung out to dry, and the bamboo poles cross each other, resembling flags rising in the smoke screen.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The rhythms of peace and prosperity in Peace Lane emerge from beneath a cloak of boisterous activity: the dung cart, the toilet broom, the stoves and chimneys in the longtang, the lines of washing hung out to dry—these are the sights and sounds that rise up through the smoky curtain of peace and prosperity.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Daily life in Ping'an is unfolded amidst the cacophony; the clatter of carts carrying manure, the sloshing of buckets, dozens of coal braziers heating up in the courtyard, clothes hung out to dry the previous night, bamboo poles intertwined, seeming to hoist flags through the smoke.

A typical day in Peace Lane is heralded by the clatter of pedicabs and the shh-shh of sandal makers working in the alleyways; the smell of horse dung and charcoal fills the air, as clothes and bedsheets are hung out to dry on the lines between the buildings, the crisscrossing poles forming a smoky canopy above the alley.

chinese: “审判日”号宽阔的甲板上很空荡，只是后甲板上有一个人在用水龙头冲洗缆桩，汪淼从高处看得很清楚，当船的这一部分从钢柱间移过的瞬间，那人的身体突然僵硬了，水龙头从他手里滑落；与此同时，连接龙头的胶皮水带也在不远处断成两截，水从那里白花花地喷了出来，那人直直地站了几秒钟就倒下了，他的身体在接触甲板的同时分成两截。
english: Judgment Day's wide deck was empty save for one man standing near the stern hosing down the ship's bollards. From his vantage point, Wang saw everything clearly. The moment that that section of the ship passed between the pillars, the hose broke into two pieces not too far from the man, and water spilled out. The man's body stiffened, and the nozzle tumbled from his hand. He remained standing for a few seconds, then fell. As his body contacted the deck, it came apart in two halves.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The ship’s broad quarter was empty as there was no one on it except for a person who was using a bucket of water to clean up the cable桩，Dong Meng could see clearly from above through the high bridge deck that the body of the person was stiffening up suddenly at the moment when the ship moved through the pillars. When the part of the ship that had passed by the masthead split the chain pipe, the water spewed out in a stream like rain, and the man stood straight for several seconds before he fell down. His body was split in two at contact with the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The ship's宽阔甲板上十分寂静，除了后甲板上的那个人正在用水龙头冲洗缆桩外，汪淼根本无法看到这个人。像人一样，当他通过这部分的钢柱时，他身体中的任何反应都戛然而止，在一瞬间他身体的另一部分从缆桩间掉出来，同时两根橡胶水带一头断成两段，溅起一滩滩水。那人站了一会儿，身体两腿分开，一头栽倒在江边的小路上，他的身体将两半分隔为两根细小的水带。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The broad deck of the Trial Day was empty, only a man on the rear deck was using the tap to rinse the mooring pins. Huang Meng looked down from above and saw the man stiffen for a moment as the ship passed over this part of its structure. Then the tap fell out of his hand. A few seconds later, the rubber hose connecting the tap snapped in two nearby. Water sprayed out of there in white spray as he straightened up and then collapsed, body split in half as he touched the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The wide deck of Judgment Day was empty save for a man who was washing the mooring posts with a water faucet. Wang looked down and saw the man freeze as the ship passed over one of the steel pillars, the faucet falling to the ground as he held it. At the same time, the ends of the water hose broke off and喷泉似的水流射到空中。那人僵硬着几秒钟后倒了下来，他的身体在触到甲板时分成两截。
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The spacious deck of the "Day of Judgment" was deserted except for a man at the stern washing a cleat with a hose; Wang Miao watched it clearly from above. When that part of the ship passed through the steel columns, the man's body suddenly stiffened, and the hose slipped from his hand. At the same time, the rubber hose that connected the faucet broke off nearby, and water sprayed out white. The man stood straight for several seconds before collapsing, and his body split in two upon contact with the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Judgment Day's broad deck was empty except for one man standing at the rear, rinsing the mooring桩 with a hose. Wang could see everything very clearly from up high. Just as the ship's stern section passed between the pillars, the man's body suddenly grew stiff, and the hose slipped from his grasp. At the same time, the plastic water hose near him broke, and water spurted out white and foamless. He stood there for several seconds, his body turning to split wood as it hit the deck.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "On the spacious deck of the ship, there was only one person washing the cables with a hose. From the top, I could see clearly. Suddenly, the person's body stiffened as the ship moved past the steel pillars. The hose slipped from his hand, and the rubber hose connected to it snapped in two. Water spewed out from there in a white mist. The person stood upright for a few seconds before collapsing. His body split into two as he made contact with the deck."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: The large deck of Judgment Day was empty, except for a man on the rear gangway, hosing down the bollards. Wang caught a clear view of him from above. When the section of deck with him on it passed between the pillars, his body stiffened, the hose slipped from his grasp, and the rubber water hose cracked apart at the same time, spraying out white frothy water. The man stood for a few seconds, then fell down. His body was sliced in half, and lay on the deck in two parts.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The broad deck of the ship named 'Judgment Day' was quite empty, except for a person on the aft deck using a hose to wash the anchor posts. Wang could see it all clearly from his high vantage point. As the ship's section moved between the steel pillars, the man's body suddenly stiffened, and the hose slipped from his hand. At the same time, the rubber hose connecting the hose also broke into two pieces somewhere nearby, spraying white water in all directions. The man stood straight for a few seconds before he fell, and as his body touched the deck, it split into two parts."

The broad deck of Judgment Day was empty, save for a man scrubbing the railing with a hose. Wang saw him stiffen up, the hose slipping from his grasp, as a section of the water hose broke free and the water spilled out in a wide arc. The man stood for a few seconds more, then fell down. His body was split by the fall into two halves, each half lying on the metal deck.

chinese: 顾炎武道：“晚村兄豪气干云，令人好生敬佩。 怕的是见不到鞑子皇帝，却死于一般的下贱奴才手里。
english: 'I admire your heroic spirit,' said Gu, 'but I don't think there's much likelihood of your meeting the Tartar Emperor face to face. You would die at the hands of miserable slaves.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Zhu Shijun said: "Lan Sen is a man of great courage, so good-natured, that he can be admired by all. However, I am afraid that I will never see Li Kang’s face, for he died at the hands of a common criminal servant."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It was you, ' said Gu Yanwu, 'to speak so loud! I can only hearken with gratitude', but I fear that your death would occur among the slaves of a low and uncivilized race.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Gu Zhewang said, "Liangyun, you have a strong spirit of rebellion. I can't help but admire your courage. The fear is that one will never see the Qing emperor, yet die at the hands of a common lowly serf."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The brashness of your courage inspires admiration, Liuliang,' said Gu Yanwu. 'I was disappointed to hear you mention the Tartar Emperor. I was hoping that you would die a hero's death at the hands of his subjects, not some lowlyvarian who might kill you as soon as he sees you are alive.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Ku Yanguo said, "Brother Wancun's bold spirit is truly awe-inspiring. The fear is that one might die at the hands of a common, lowly slave before ever laying eyes on the Mongol emperor."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): I'm sure you'd rather challenge the Tartar Emperor to a duel and fight him like a man,' said Gu Yanwu, 'than be murdered by some lowly scoundrel who doesn't even deserve to die for his trouble.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The content of the translated text is: "I admire your bold and honorable character, late brother. What I fear is that I may not get to see the emperor, but die at the hands of a common slave instead."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: 'You're a true hero, Liuliang,'said Gu Yanwu. 'I admire your bravery. But I fear that now we won't get to see the Tartar Emperor, but will be killed by some mean, contemptible little servant.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Gu Yanwu Martial Arts: "Wancun Xiong has a majestic aura, inspiring respect. What's tragic is that he didn't encounter the Qi Clan Emperor, yet died at the hands of a common slave."
Your determination to go through with it was what won my admiration,' said Gu Yanwu. 'What I fear is that you should die in the hands of some low-down, mean-spirited Thai official.

chinese: 韦小宝记得茅十八在酒馆中与七名大汉相斗的手法，突然左手出拳，击向那男孩下颚，砰的一声，正好打中。
english: Trinket recalled Whiskers' fight with the seven wrestlers at the inn, and shot out a quick left that caught the boy hard, fair and square, on the lower cheek.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wang Xiaobang remembered that when seven big men were fighting with him at a tavern, he threw his left hand out and struck the boy’s jaw. It hit perfectly on target.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He had heard Trinket describe how the old eunuch had struck one of the seven wrestling men with his left hand and knocked him down; there seemed to be some sort of crack at the boy's lower back, and the punch somehow have hit him刚好。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaoya remembered how he had used his left hand to punch the seven big men fighting with him at the inn, striking the boy’s chin. Bang! It hit exactly where it was supposed to.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket memorised the struggle he had seen between Whiskers and a number of thugs in the tavern, and threw his left hand down at the boy's jaw just as they met. It connected perfectly, with a BANG!
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Wu Xiaobao remembered how Mao Bajiu had fought seven big men in a tavern. Suddenly, he swung his left fist, striking the boy's chin with a loud thud, which landed precisely on target.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket had picked up some fighting techniques from Whiskers' remarkable heroics in the inn earlier. Remembering how he had knocked out the paper-maker's tooth with a single blow, he now swung his left fist down at the boy's jaw.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Wu Xiaobao remembered the technique that he used to defeat the seven men at the wine tavern. Suddenly, he punched out with his left hand, hitting the boy's chin with a loud thud, hitting it right on target.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Trinket had seen Whiskers' performance in the tavern. gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Wei Xiaobao remembered the martial art technique that Ma Sanba used in the tavern against the seven Han men, suddenly his left hand struck a punch towards the boy, making a sound of "deng" as it hit the mark perfectly.
Trinket remembered Whiskers' fight with the seven wrestlers in the tavern. He suddenly jabbed out with his left fist, and this time he was right.

chinese: 一面说，一面禁不住流泪，又怕宝玉烦恼，只得又勉强忍着。
english: She cried weakly as she said this, but presently checked herself for fear of upsetting Bao-yu.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She was泪流满面,但一想万一宝玉难过,就不容易强忍,只得努力的忍着。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: On one hand, he was weeping and on the other, he tried not to let his tears fall. He feared that if he did so, it would trouble宝玉. So he had no choice but to try to hold back his tears.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She burst into tears, fearing that Bao-yu would be upset and had to struggle to control herself.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: As she spoke, tears couldn't help but well up in her eyes, yet she feared causing Bao Yu distress, so she had to force herself to hold back.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): She began to shed tears of her own, but was afraid of hurting Bao-yu's feelings and restrained them by a great effort.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: One side, she said, one side she couldn't help but cry. But she didn't want to upset the Jade, so she forced herself to hold back.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She was in such a state of excitement that she almost forgot her pretended anger and burst into tears. Bao-yu looked at her sympathetically. She forced herself to pull herself together and to smile brightly for his sake.

chinese: 韦小宝道：“不降！” 欲待挺腰翻起，蓦地里腰间一阵酸麻，后腰两处穴道已被小玄子屈指抵住，那正是海老公昨晚所教的手法，自己虽然学会了，却给对方抢先用出。
english: 'No! Never!' protested Trinket, but when he tried to straighten himself up and get to his feet, he felt a sudden numbness in the small of his back. Misty had beaten him to it! He had pressed on exactly the spot Old Hai had been trying to teach him the previous evening.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Qian Baogang said, “Don’t!” He wanted to stand up straight and lift his leg. A moment later, he felt a sudden pain in his backside and two spots on his back were being blocked by Sheng Xiu. It was what Huaji taught him that night, but he had already been given advantage by his opponent.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): No, sir,' said Trinket, but suddenly switching to  blast-firing range he found his spine aching and some bruising in the area of the little melon-plate: what had been done in the preceding hour was already明知不可之事, though at the time he had no power to say so.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaoya said, "No surrender!" He wanted to straighten up and roll over but suddenly his waist was pained and ached. Two points of the meridians on his back had been blocked by Xiao Xuanzi's finger tips. That was precisely what Sea Husband taught him last night. Even though he learned it, he had been beaten to death by someone else.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): No, no, no!' said Trinket. He was about to spring to his feet when suddenly a sharp pain stabbed through the lower part of his back and upper thighs. It was Misty's third finger pressing into the vital points of the Emperor's body. Trinket had learned the move from the old eunuch's demonstration only a few days ago; but this time Misty had got there first.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Villain Xiaobao refused to surrender!" As he was about to try to roll out of the way, a sharp numbness spread through his lower back, and he realized that Xiao Yuan had pressed his two acupuncture points with her fingers, just as Old Sea had taught him last night. Although he had learned the technique, she had managed to use it before him.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Never!' protested Trinket, as he tried to force himself up and kick Misty in the face. But at that moment a numbing pain shot through his lower back and he found both of his lumbar points simultaneously gripped by Misty's fingernails, the very same ones the old eunuch had demonstrated the previous evening. He had seen the technique, but now, though he knew how it was done, he could do nothing against it.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Wait!" Wei Xiaobao said, "I won't give up!" He tried to stand up, but his waist felt a sharp pain as if he was being stabbed. The two acupoints on his lower back were already being pressed by the little old man's finger. chinese: 其实伟大友谊不真也不假，就如世上一切东西一样，你信它是真，它就真下去。 你疑它是假，它就是假的。 我的话也半真不假。 但是我随时准备兑现我的话，哪怕天崩地裂也不退却。
english: Actually, the great friendship was neither true nor false, like everything else in the world. It was true if you believed it, and false if you didn't; my words were also neither true nor false, but I was prepared to stand by my words anytime and wouldn't back off even if the sky collapsed and the earth cracked open.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In fact, great friendship is not just true or false, but also like everything in this world, you can trust it as long as you believe it is real. If you doubt its authenticity, it will be fake too. My words are half truth and half lie. But I am always prepared to keep my words, no matter how great the disaster is.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The truth is, great friendship is never false; it exists only because someone trusts it enough to believe it real. If you doubt that, great friend, may the turmoil of a mountainaise not减弱它的庄严。 May the world swallow up what doubts its existence may contain—for even if the universe itself were destroyed, I shall be prepared to keep my word. May whatever I say no matter what happens be fulfilled, provided it is believed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Actually, great friendship is not true nor false like all things on earth, you believe it's real, and it will continue to be so; you doubt that it's fake, and it will become so. My words are half true and half false, but I am always ready to keep my word even if the world is about to end.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Their great friendship was neither true nor false, like everything else in the world. If you believed that it was true, it would continue to be; if you suspected that it was false, it would become true. Or so I might say; but I meant only that it should be made public. I was ready at a moment's notice to stand by whatever I had said, even though the world itself should collapse around us.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Actually, great friendships are neither true nor false; just like everything in this world, they become true or false depending on your belief. If you believe they are true, they will be so. If you doubt they are false, they will indeed appear that way. My words are also somewhat true and somewhat not; but I am always ready to fulfill my promises, no matter how catastrophic the situation becomes.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Actually, our great friendship was neither true nor false; like everything in this world, it depends on your point of view. If you believe it's real, it will be real; if you doubt it's fake, it will be fake. My words are also half true and half false, but I'm ready to fulfill my words at any time, no matter how the earth may shake.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The greatness of true friendship is not a lie, just like everything else in the world. If you believe it's true, it will be true. If you doubt it's a lie, it will be a lie. My words are not entirely true, but I am always ready to keep my promises, no matter how the world crumbles around us.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Actually, our great friendship was not entirely fictional, just as nothing in this world is entirely fictional. Whatever you believe, it will be that way; whatever you doubt, it will not be so. As for my words, they were half-true and half-false. But I would have stood by my words even if the sky had fallen and the earth had collapsed.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The great friendship is neither real nor false, just like all things in the world. If you believe it is real, it becomes real. If you doubt it is false, it becomes false. My words are also half true and not false. However, I am always ready to fulfill my words, even if the sky falls and the earth splits, I will not retreat.

Actually, great friendship is not something to be scoffed at, any more than anything else in this world. If you believe it is true, it is true; if you think it is false, it is false. My words are also not entirely untrue. I am ready to repay my debts, even if the world should come to an end.

chinese: 她曾经盼望着早日成婚，但从女伴的话语中隐隐约约听到单家公子是个麻风病患者，奶奶的心凉了，奶奶向她的父母诉说着心中的忧虑。 外曾祖父遮遮掩掩不回答，外曾祖母把奶奶的女伴们痛骂一顿，其意大概是说狐狸吃不到葡萄就说葡萄是酸的之类。
english: Eager to marry, she heard innuendos from her girlfriends that the Shan boy was afflicted with leprosy, and her dreams began to evaporate. Yet, when she shared her anxieties with her parents, Great-Granddad hemmed and hawed, while Great-Grandma scolded the girlfriends, accusing them of sour grapes.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: She longed for marriage but never heard from her female companions that Sun Family Lord Song was a leprosy patient, and her grandmother’s heart sank when she heard of it. Her father’s grandfather had concealed his answer, and her mother’s granddaughter vented on him about how foxes can’t eat grapes because they’re sour.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She had hoped for a child and a happy married life, but Grandma began to feel cold when the maid at the party was mentioned, and she became worried for her granddaughters' happiness. Great-Granddad ambidextrously changed the subject and told Grandma that the fact that Uncle Qian's family was sick wasn't affecting the young man enough; he gave Grandmother a nasty lecture about how foxes don't eat grapes because they're bitter.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: She had longed for marriage to happen soon, but she heard faintly that the single young man was a leper and her grandmother's heart sank. She told her parents about her worry. The old grandfather didn't answer, and the old grandmother scolded the girls who were her daughter-in-law's friends, saying that they should be ashamed of themselves if they ate grapes while others couldn't.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She once had hoped fervently that their wedding day would come soon, but gradually began to worry after she learned that the Shans' son-in-law was a leper. Granddad kept up his excuses about not wanting to discuss this private matter over the telephone, and Grandma forbade her female friends to talk about it, telling them that if a fox doesn't get the grape, it can say the grape is sour; they should keep their secrets.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: She had long been eager for marriage, but the suggestion that the only son of the Chan family was a leper from her female companions' remarks cooled her grandmother's spirits. She confided her concerns to her parents, who in turn sought answers from their own elders. The great-grandfather evaded the question, while the great-grandmother sharply reprimanded her grandmother's female companions, perhaps implying that if one cannot have something, they should at least admit its value, akin to the fable of the fox unable to reach grapes.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): She had once longed for marriage, but hints from her girlfriends that the young Mister Shan was suffering from leprosy had chilled her enthusiasm. She complained to her parents, who hedged and dodged; but her grandmother finally took her handmaids' names in vain, perhaps because they were jealous of the grape that they could not reach.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: She once longed for an early marriage, but from her companion's words, she vaguely heard that the man was a leper. Her grandmother's heart sank, and she confided in her parents about her worries. The grandfather-in-law tried to cover it up, and the grandmother scolded her companions, implying that they were saying that lemons are sour if they can't get grapes.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She had once looked forward to her wedding day, but when she overheard the girls talking, she learned that the man had leprosy. Her heart froze, and she complained to her parents, but her grandfather shrugged and her grandmother scolded the girls mercilessly, implying that foxes don't eat grapes because they're sour.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: She once hoped to marry soon, but from her partner's words, she subtly heard that the partner's family has a history of epilepsy. Her grandmother's heart sank, and she expressed her concerns to her parents. The great-grandfather remained silent, and the great-grandmother harshly scolded her partners, implying that she was complaining about minor issues.

She had looked forward to her wedding day with anticipation, but gradually heard from her girlfriends that the bachelor was a leper. Grandma's heart was filled with grief, and she voiced her concerns to her parents. But her father, who had died of leprosy, covered up the truth out of shame, and Grandma's girlfriends, perhaps sensing that she was unwelcome, treated her harshly, saying that since the fruit of the grape is sour, the vine must be sour as well.

As Old Colour walked along the street, the wind came rushing towards him from the apartment blocks on either side of the street. The wind had been squeezed through the gaps in the buildings and seemed to have lost none of its strength. chinese: 我听说奶奶会吸大烟但不上瘾，所以始终面如桃花，神清气爽，用螃蟹喂过的罂粟花朵肥硕壮大，粉、红、白三色交杂，香气扑鼻。
english: Apparently Grandma was an opium smoker, but wasn't addicted, which was why she had the complexion of a peach, a sunny disposition, and a clear mind. The crab-nourished poppies grew huge and fleshy, a mixture of pinks, reds, and whites that assailed your nostrils with their fragrance.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I heard that my grandmother would smoke a lot but not get addicted to it, so she always looked like a flower with her cheeks flushed pink and her spirit clear. When she fed the罂粟花上的螃蟹，she was able to grow large mushrooms of various colors, which had a strong fragrance.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I've heard Grandma could smoke but not get addicted to it; therefore she had the face of a girl's bloom and a clear, lively mind, the same as one would expect from a tomato pod fertilized by powders of red, white, and blue poppies.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I heard that my grandmother smoked, but never got addicted, so she remained as beautiful and clear-headed as ever, with flowers of opium fed by crabs, blooming big and strong, a mixture of pink, red, and white, the scent overwhelming.

unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: I heard that my grandmother used to indulge in opium but never became addicted, so she always looked radiant, with a clear mind and vibrant spirit. Her large poppy flowers, nourished by crabs, were lush and robust, featuring a mix of pink, red, and white colors, with their fragrance wafting in the air.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): I'd heard that Grandma knew how to smoke without getting hooked, which was why her face always looked blooming and she appeared so fresh and alert; she must have used the crab meat to enhance the growth of her opium poppies, whose blossoms, in shades of pink, red, and white, smelled deliciously fragrant.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: I heard that my grandmother smokes, but she never gets addicted. She always looks like a peach blossom with a clear and refreshing aura. chinese: 大楼顶上出现了一个娇小的身影，那个美丽的女孩子挥动着一面“四·二八”的大旗，她的出现立刻招来了一阵杂乱的枪声，射击的武器五花八门，有陈旧的美式卡宾枪、捷克式机枪和三八大盖，也有崭新的制式步枪和冲锋枪——后者是在“八月社论”发表之后从军队中偷抢来的——连同那些梭标和大刀等冷兵器，构成了一部浓缩的近现代史……
english: The slender figure of a beautiful young girl emerged at the top of the building, waving the giant red banner of the April Twenty-eighth Brigade. Her appearance was greeted immediately by a cacophony of gunshots. The weapons attacking her were a diverse mix: antiques such as American carbines, Czech-style machine guns, Japanese Type-38 rifles; newer weapons such as standard-issue People's Liberation Army rifles and submachine guns, stolen from the PLA after the publication of the 'August Editorial'; and even a few Chinese dadao swords and spears. Together, they formed a condensed version of modern history.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: A tiny girl appears at the top of a building, with her elegant appearance attracting a sudden flurry of gunfire as she waved a “Four-28” flag. The sight instantly drew outgun fire from all directions, which soon turned to chaos when one shot was fired by each weapon, ranging from the old American M1 carbine and Czech machine guns to new models such as the M4 assault rifle and冲锋枪。 In addition to the weapons like swords and bows, this collection is also packed with cold兵器，including spears and long knives — these items were stolen from the army after the “Eight-October Manifesto” was published.

These latter were taken by the army after they published the "Eight-Month Editorial." They also included sabers and swords like cold arms, which formed a condensed history of modern times...

chinese: 将她抱起，坐在椅上，说道：“你瞧着，我在你身上各个部位指点，倘若指得对的，你就眨三下眼睛，指得不对，眼睛睁得大大的，一动也不能动。
english: He lifted her up in his arms and sat her down in a chair. 'Now look,' he said, 'I'm going to start pointing to places on your body. If I point to the right place, blink three times; if it isn't right, just keep your eyes open and don't move.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Hold her up, sit down on the chair, and say to her, "Look at all your body parts; if you look right, you'll make three eyes blink; if you look wrong, you'll open wide and won't be able to move."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She was taken down to be held up against the chair and helped herself to the computer to look over her drawings. If she made any correct drawing, the doctor told her, she would rub the drawing together with her eyes, as if trying to memorize it; but if the artist-made drawings were incorrect, the doctor told her, she should never be able to move her body at all.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Carry her up and put her on the chair, and say: "Look at me, I'll point out where you have a problem, if you can find the problems with my pointing, then close your eyes three times, otherwise keep your eyes wide open and don't move."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He sat him down on the chair and began rubbing his shoulder. 'Look at me, Now! I'll tell you which parts of your body I want to see, and when I've pointed them out to you, blink three times if they're right; don't blink if they're wrong. If they're wrong, keep your eyes open very wide and don't move at all.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Lifting her up, placing her on a chair, he said, "Watch closely. I'll point out various parts of your body. If I'm correct, you blink three times. If not, your eyes remain wide open, unable to move."

chinese: 炎武兄眼见事势紧急，忙瞩伊璜先生家人连夜躲避；想起伊璜先生和晚村兄交好，特来探访。”

chinese: 潘寒露出神秘的笑容说：“不错，但假如构成计算机的三千万个士兵，每个人在一秒钟内可以挥动黑白小旗十万次，总线上的轻骑兵的奔跑速度是几倍音速甚至更快，结果就不一样了。
english: Pan gave a mysterious smile. 'You're right. But suppose that of the thirty million soldiers forming the computer, each one is capable of raising and lowering the black and white flags a hundred thousand times per second, and suppose also that the light cavalry soldiers on the main bus can run at several times the speed of sound, or even faster. Then the result would be very different.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: PAN Lin smiled with a mysterious smile and said, "That's fine, but if you had three million soldiers who could move black and white flags every second, the speed of the light cavalry would be several times faster than the speed of sound or even faster. As a result, things will be different."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): This is not a bad assumption, Mr. Pan, although if the three billion soldiers of a computer were made out of pictures of black and white flags like the soldiers in the Battle of the Bulles Mountains, their running speed over a distance would be several times the speed of sound—and this would give rise to very different results.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Pan Han smiled mysteriously and said, "That's right, but if the three million soldiers that make up a computer can move their black-and-white flags 100,000 times per second, then the speed of the light cavalry on the main line is several times the speed of sound or even faster, the results would be different."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Pan laughed mysteriously. 'Yes, but imagine if the computers were made up of three hundred million soldiers, and each of these soldiers could wave a black-and-white flag 10,000 times per second, eliminating the lag between requests for data transfer across the bus. The result would be vastly different.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Pan Han revealed a mysterious smile and said, "That's correct. But if you consider three million soldiers that make up the computer, each of whom can wave black-and-white little flags ten thousand times within a second, and the speed of the cavalry on the bus is several times the speed of sound or even faster, the outcome would be different."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Pan gave a sly smile. 'You're right. But suppose three million soldiers, each equipped with a black or white little flag? And suppose these soldiers could wave their flags ten times per second. And suppose the light cavalry running on the wires travels at supersonic speed—or even faster. Then the outcome would be different.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Pan smiled mysteriously and said, "Not bad. But if we had three million soldiers in our computer army, each one could wave their black and white flags ten million times in one second. The speed of our light cavalry on the wire would be many times faster than the speed of sound."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Pan's smile was enigmatic. 'Not bad. But suppose the thousands of soldiers composing the computer can wave their white and black flags ten million times per second. Then the speed of the cavalry on the bus lines would be several times the speed of light, and the result would be very different.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Pan Hanlou spoke mysteriously, "It's good, but if there were three million soldiers in a computer, each one able to wave a black and white flag ten thousand times per second, the speed of the light cavalry on the bus would be several times faster than the speed of sound, or even faster. The result would be different."

Pan gave his mysterious smile. 'It's not bad, but if those three billion people were the building blocks of a computer, and each could flutter his white-and-black flag a million times in a second, and the light cavalry on the wires rode at speeds far faster than the speed of sound, the result would be very different.

chinese: 不看僧面看佛面，不看鱼面看水面，不看我的面子也要看豆官的面子上，留下吧，你要我…… 我也给你…… 你就像我的爹一样……”
english: 'If not for the sake of the monk, stay for the Buddha. If not for the sake of the fish, stay for the water. If not for my sake, stay for little Douguan. You can have me, if you want. . . . You're like my own father. . . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Do not look at a monk's face, do not look at a fish's face, do not look at my face either, but look at the face of the Buddha or water; leave it; you will give me... I also give you... You like my father so much that I am giving you ...
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): If I had looked down on the Buddhist scriptures and turned my face towards the佛面, instead of the water surface, and ignored the fact that some of your men still regarded me with such respect, I would have left you with a place on my heart—and you're right—because you are my grandfather's grandson. I would have rewarded you for finding my shortcomings; like my granddad, you put up with—and I appreciate —my shortcomings because I'm too old to change.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Look at the Buddha not the monk, look at the water not the fish, don't look at my face but at that of the bean seller, take him with you, you want me... I'll give you as well... You're like my father..."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The Buddha on one side and the Buddha on the other—whatever! As for the fish, I can't break my oath! But if you'll leave me, Master, I'll stand between you and the river and give you my help... like a father stands between a child and a monster!'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Even if you don't consider my face, please think of the Buddha's face, or at least the water's surface. Even if you won't listen to me, you should at least give face to Dou Guan. Stay here. If you want something from me, I'll give it to you... You're like my father..."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): At the very least, do it for the sake of Buddhist faces and watery faces. And besides, if you don't take my advice, you won't be doing Bean-pod any favours either. You'd better stay here tonight. You're like my own son.'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Look at the Buddha's face, not my face. Look at the fish's face, not the water's face. Look at the official's face, not mine. Leave it there, you want me to be like your father to you."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Don't look in the monk's face, don't look in the Buddha's face, don't look in the fish's face, don't look in the village official's face, they will stretch your skin and boil you in hot water. But if you look in my face, I'll give you what I give to my father...'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Don't look at the monk's face, look at the Buddha's face. Don't look at the fish's face, look at the water's face. Even if you don't look at my face, you should still look at the official's face. Leave it, you want me... I also give you... You are like my father... "

I'll look after your face, just as you look after the Buddha's. And you can look after my face, as I look after your father's. Leave your fish-wife's face with me, and I'll give you mine in exchange. . . .'

chinese: 爷爷的思想当时麻木地凝滞在一个点上，这一点或许是一张扭歪的脸，或许是一管断裂的枪、一颗飞躜着的尖头子弹。

gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Grandfather's thoughts were frozen at a particular point, this point might have been a twisted face, or a broken gun, or a flying bullet with a sharp tip.

chinese: 她家先生一九四九年前是一爿灯泡厂的厂主，公私合营后做了副厂长，照严家师母的话， 就是摆摆样子的。

chinese: 因此，他们无名无姓的，默默耕耘着自己的一方田地。

chinese: 他奶奶的，沐公爷手下，只怕真有几个厉害人物，不可不防。
english: There are some really dangerous people among that Mu lot, you can't afford to take any chances.

You'd better not waste your time practising on me,' said Bao-yu with a laugh. 'Tomorrow you'll have to do without my help.'

chinese: 沙瑞山又搬出一台笔记本电脑，手忙脚乱地启动系统，插上宽带网线，然后打电话—— 汪淼听出他在联系乌鲁木齐射电观测基地——然后等待着。

Sha brought out a laptop and fumbled with the power button, then connected it to the internet with a wide-band cable. He made a phone call, and Wang heard him dialing the number for the radio observatory in Urumqi. Then he waited.

chinese: 只觉天涯茫茫，到处是鞑子的天下，真无一片干净土地，沉吟道：“桃源何处，可避暴秦？
english: The whole world belonged to the Tartars now, it seemed. Not a single patch of land was free of their hated presence. He thought of the poet Tao Yuanming's story about the fisherman who, by following a stream that flowed between flowering peach trees, had stumbled on an earthly paradise—a place where refugees from ancient tyranny had found a haven.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Only felt that it was as if there were no clear land at all, and pondered for a moment: “Where is the place where the barbarian can escape?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He could but feel that, miles and miles away the Mongols were his equals, not here; every safe place looked nearly as far off, and he grew thoughtful. 'Well,' he said. 'Where might you look for a place to hide the monster Trinket?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Only felt the land of the Tartars everywhere, a place without a clean piece of land, and pondered, "Where is the secluded paradise that can avoid the tyrannical Qin?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): In his heart every inch of these barren lands belonged to the Tartars and held no trace of the slightest bit of decency. He was therefore more than ever driven to the thought of a hidden idyllic place somewhere where a man could escape from the tyrannical grip of the Qin.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Feeling the vastness of the world as desolate as the steppes filled with the rule of the barbarian tribes, there seemed not a single spot of pure land left. They pondered, "Where is the Peach Blossom Spring, a place to escape the tyrannical Qin?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): But a sudden dread of the vast, all-Conqueror realm beyond, in which there seemed to be no clean, uncontaminated place, made him pause. 'Where is this lost valley they talk about?' he asked himself.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: I feel like the world is vast and desolate, everywhere is the territory of the barbarians. There is no spot of pure land. I sigh and ask, "Where is the haven of peach blossoms where I can escape from the brutal Qin dynasty?"
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: 'Oh, the desolation of this Tartar-dominated world! There is not a patch of decent ground to be found from one end to the other. Where, in the Peach Tree Stream region, can one find a hiding-place from this bloodthirsty Qin ruler?
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Where is the Peach Blossom Spring? Where can one escape the Qin dynasty?
The horizon was blurred and indistinct, like a mirror in which one can see nothing but one's own reflection. 'Ah, Peach Tree Stream,' he murmured, 'where are you hidden?

chinese: 有时你会觉着那里比较嘈杂，推开窗便噪声盈耳，你不要怪它，这就是简约人生聚沙成塔的动静。 他们毕竟是活泼泼的，也是要有些声响的。
english: On occasion you might feel that it is rather noisy—as soon as the windows were opened, your ears would be assaulted by all kinds of sounds. But don't be offended: what you hear are the accumulated sounds of the activities of prudent people over their lifetime; at least the noise shows that they are lively.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: From time to time, you’ll feel that there is a lot of noise around, but opening the window will fill it up with sound. You don’t have to blame it; it’s all about simplicity in life – living in harmony with the environment.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): At times you can feel more crowded, and the window opens to a sound that fills the room. Don't blame them—this is the so-called silence generated by the sand falling onto a pond. They are still, but still capable of making noise.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Sometimes you may feel there is too much noise, and the window will be filled with sound. Don't blame it. That's how the simple life of gathering sand into a tower produces its own noises. They are lively enough, after all, and they need some sounds.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): On occasion you might even think that the street is a bit noisier: just open the window and you have an overload of noise. You shouldn't blame the street; it is simply living out its simple life, like gathering sand into a tower. They are lively and make sounds of their own.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Sometimes you might feel that it's a bit noisy there, with noise filling your ears when you open the window. Don't blame it; this is simply the sound of simple life accumulating like sand to form a tower. After all, they are lively creatures, needing some noise to exist.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Sometimes you might feel that the east side is noisier. When you open the window you'll hear noise on all sides. Do not complain, because that is the sound of minimalist life, built from grains of sand. They are lively, after all, and must make some noise.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: Sometimes you may feel that it's too noisy, but when you open the window, the noise is overwhelming. Don't blame it, this is just the dynamic movement of people who have gathered sand to build a tower.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Sometimes the place may seem overwhelmingly noisy when you open the window; but don't blame it for that. That is just the clamor of people building a tower out of shifting sands.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: At times, it can be noisy there, and the noise seeps in when you open the window. Don't blame it; this is the bustle of simple lives piling up to form a tower. They are indeed lively, and they should have some noise.

Sometimes it seems to be a bit busy there, and you have to close the window to shut out the noise. Don't blame the place; it's the price you pay for the vibrant, active life of those who build sand castles with their bare hands.

chinese: 突然心想：“满洲武士打不过茅大哥，茅大哥又不是老乌龟的对手，何不骗得老乌龟教我些本事？”
english: Suddenly a thought occurred to him. 'The wrestlers were no match for Whiskers; but Whiskers was no match for Old Turtle-head—why don't I get him to teach me a few moves?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Suddenly he thought: “The imperial samurai cannot defeat Xiao Bao, and Xiao Bao is not a turtle’s opponent; why not trick him and teach him some skills?”
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But at the moment a thought occurred to him that: 'If the Mongol soldiers can't beat my brother Whiskers, Whiskers certainly isn't as good as he seems. Why not try and get Old Geng to teach me some of the kinds of things I need?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Suddenly, I thought, "A Mongol warrior can't beat Master Mao; Mao is not the opponent of Old Turtle. Why not deceive Old Turtle and teach me some skills?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): What if he'd thought that one of the Manchu warriors had gotten the better of him, and that Whiskers wasn't strong enough to beat a much bigger man like that? Then maybe he could fool Old Whiskers into teaching him something!
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Suddenly, I thought to myself: "The Manchu warriors can't beat Brother Mao, and neither can Brother Mao beat Old Tortoise. Why not trick Old Tortoise into teaching me some skills?"
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): But then it occurred to him that since the Manchu guards had been beaten by Whiskers, and since Whiskers was no match for the Old Devil, why shouldn't he trick the Old Devil into teaching him some moves?
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Suddenly, I thought: "The Manchurian warrior can't defeat Big Brother, and Big Brother is not the old turtle's opponent. Why not deceive the old turtle into teaching me some skills?"</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: But almost at once he was thinking, The Musk is no match for a Martial Hero! And a Martial Hero is no match for an Old Devil like me! Why shouldn't I trick the Old Devil into teaching me a thing or two?

chinese: 他听到我曾外祖父舌头僵硬地说：“闺女…… 你…… 一泡尿尿了这半天……
english: He heard Great-Granddad, whose tongue had grown thick in his mouth, say: 'Daughter . . . you . . . what took you so long to take a piss? . . .

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Old Professor,' he said, rigiding his tongue, 'the little girl's one bucked too. She needs to pee. You know she's been pissing all day....
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He heard my grandfather say, "Daughter... You've peed for half a day now..."

chinese: 王文义用白布捂着血耳朵，满脸哭相。
english: Wang Wenyi, on the other hand, wore a crestfallen look as he held the cloth to his injured ear.

chinese: 阿伧族的女人都很漂亮，身上挂了很多铜箍和银钱。
english: Ahcang women were all very pretty, their bodies adorned with many bronze bracelets and necklaces and silver coins.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The Acheans were very beautiful, and had added silver and copper rings to their bracelets.

unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: The women of the Hui ethnic group are all very beautiful, adorned with numerous copper bracelets and silver coins.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): The Aghans were a handsome people, men and women alike, and adorned their bodies with copper bracelets and silver medallions.

chinese: 晚村兄何不便题诗一首，将二瞻先生之意，表而出之？”
english: Why don't you do an inscription, Liuliang — a poem that will give voice to what Erzhan had in mind to say?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: What difficulty has late Mr. Kuo faced when he wrote a poem? He wishes to express his respect for Professor Bao by writing it out."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But dear Liuliang, for some unexpected gift or reward you couldn't find the temerity to give me, so please write a poem for me! I would like to read it and舞毕!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Uncle Wenchen, why not compose a poem for me? I would like you to express Mr. Zhan's thoughts?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Why don't you put a few lines on each of the plates to show what Erzhan wants to say?'
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Brother Wan Cun, why not write a poem? This would express Mr. Zhan's intention more clearly."
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Why don't you compose a poem on Iliana's behalf, Wangxun, and help to make our friendship known?'
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: "Hey, brother, don't you think it's a good idea to write a poem about our friend Mr. Two? Let's express his thoughts through it."</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: 'You could write a poem on it, couldn't you, Liuliang,' said the old man. 'Put it in verse, and so give us all a chance of understanding what he meant.'
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Why doesn't Older Brother Wang compose a poem to express the meaning of Mr. Er's thoughts?"
Why shouldn't you compose a poem for him, Brother Liuliang?'

chinese: 这时，她倒平静下来，心情也松弛了，等那化妆师结束工作走开时，她甚至还生出几分幽默感同吴佩珍开玩笑。 吴佩珍说她简直像是嫦娥下凡，她就说嫦娥也是月饼盒上的嫦娥，于是两人都笑。
english: It was then that she began to calm down and her tensions eased. By the time the makeup man finished his job, she had even started to regain her sense of humor and joked around a bit with Wu Peizhen, who remarked that Wang Qiyao looked like the Lady in the Moon descending into the secular world, whereupon Wang Qiyao quipped that if she were a Lady in the Moon, she was the kind whose image was found on boxes of mooncakes. The two of them had a good laugh.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: At this moment, she calmed down and her mood also relaxed. After the makeup artist was done working, she even had a bit of humor with Gai-Pei. Gai-Pei said that she looked like the moon goddess, and she said that the moon goddess was also the moon box. They both laughed.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): She became more calm and relaxed just as the makeup man was about to leave. Even before he left, she even managed a little humor at Wang Qiyao: How can it be that a girl like her must come down from heaven with a cookie box on her face? And so they both laughed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: At this moment, she calmed down and relaxed. When the makeup artist finished his work and walked away, even a sense of humor appeared in her heart for a while. Ruan Peizhen said that she was like Chang'e coming down from the moon. She said that Chang'e was also a woman on the box of the mooncake. So both of them laughed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): All of a sudden, she was calm and relaxed, even laughing at the makeup man, who had finished with her and left the bedroom door open for her.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: At that moment, she calmed down and her mood relaxed. Even when the makeup artist finished her work and left, she found herself adding a touch of humor by joking with Wu Peizhen. Wu Peizhen commented that she looked like Chang'e descending from heaven, to which she replied that Chang'e was also the one depicted on the mooncake box, leading both of them to laugh.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Only after a moment or two did she calm down and begin to enjoy herself. She even found the humor in the situation as she teased Wu Peizhen, who had declared her to be a降临凡间的嫦娥; Wang Qiyao responded with a comment about how she was only the mooncake-box version of Chang'e, and they both laughed.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: When she calmed down, she felt more relaxed and even joked with the makeup artist. The makeup artist said she looked like a fairy from the moon, and she replied that the fairy was also on the mooncake box. They both laughed.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: She became calm and relaxed, even joking around with Wu Peizhen about how she looked like the fox-fairy Chang'e who had drunk the magic soup and descended to earth. They both laughed at the comparison.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: At that time, she calmed down and her mood relaxed. When the makeup artist finished work and left, she even showed a bit of humor with Wu Pei-zhen joking around. Wu Pei-zhen said she was just like Chang'e descending to earth, and she replied that Chang'e was also the Chang'e on the mooncake box, so both of them laughed.

She became much calmer and even generously laughed with Wu Peizhen a few times as they worked. When the makeup man finally finished and left, she even joked with Wu Peizhen that she was now like the mythical beauty Jia Rui—Wu Peizhen agreed that she was, and they both laughed.

chinese: 一已开进门去，院子是浅的，客堂也是浅的，三步两步便走穿过去，一道木楼梯挡在了头顶。
english: But, upon entering, one discovers that the courtyard is modest and the reception area narrow—two or three steps and you are already at the wooden staircase across the room.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In a single step out of his door, the courtyard was shallow, the living room was also shallow, and he walked past it in three steps two steps at a time. There was a wooden staircase blocking his path above him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He went out into the courtyard, where it was merely a sliver. His guests, on the other hand, had to walk through a wooden partition that served as a stepping stone and blocked his view.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: As soon as the door was opened, the courtyard was shallow and the living room was also shallow. It only took three steps or two to walk through. A wooden staircase blocked his way above.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But once through the gateway they are suddenly transported somewhere else, a low courtyard on one side and a low guest room on the other; navigable between these in no more than steps or stairs.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: As soon as they entered the door, the courtyard was shallow, and the living room was also shallow. In just a few steps, one could easily walk through it, with a wooden staircase blocking their path overhead.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Once you pass through the gate, you find that the courtyard and the guest suite are not very far apart; you can traverse both in a few steps. Then a flight of stairs blocks your way.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: As soon as I entered the door, I found myself in a small courtyard. The living room was also small, and I could easily walk through it in three steps. A wooden staircase blocked my way at the top.</s>
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Once inside, the courtyard was surprisingly small, and the reception room even smaller. She could stride through it in a couple of paces, a wooden staircase stretching up across the top of her head.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: Entered and walked through the shallow courtyard, the hall was also shallow. In just a few steps, I walked right through it. A wooden staircase blocked the ceiling.
Once inside the gate, the courtyard was not deep; nor was the guest room. She was through in a few steps, and a wooden staircase blocked the head of the room.

chinese: 对她来说，我就是那个急匆匆从山上赶下去的背影，一个记忆中的人。
english: To her, I was the precise image of someone seen from behind, hurrying down the mountain, a man in her memory.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: To her, I was that hurried back from the mountains, a person from memory.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): For her, all I was was the fast-trip back down the mountain, and that was the memory of someone.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: For her, I was the figure racing down the mountain as if from a memory, a person long gone.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): To her, I was the man rushing down the mountain急于赶到别人身边的那个人, a memory already formed.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: To her, I was that hurried silhouette hurrying down the mountain, a figure from her memory.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): To her, I were the hurried figure rushing down the mountain, someone out of her memory.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: For her, I am that hasty figure who rushed down the mountain, a memory in her mind.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: To her I was just the shadow of a man rushing down the mountain, a figure from her memory.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: To her, I am the hurried figure rushing down from the mountain, a person in her memory.
To her, I was the hurried figure rushing down the mountain, a memory from the past.

chinese: 士隐见女儿越发生得粉装玉琢，乖觉可喜，便伸手接来抱在怀中斗他玩耍一回， 又带至街前，看那过会的热闹。
english: Her delicate little pink-and-white face seemed dearer to him than ever at that moment, and he stretched out his arms to take her and hugged her to him. After playing with her for a while at his desk, he carried her out to the front of the house to watch the bustle in the street.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The scholar was so engrossed in his daughter that he became so dressed up and pretentious that he could hardly contain himself from laughing at him, thus taking her away for a play. He then took her back to the street where he would see the lively crowd.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Shi-yin saw a change had been done in the beauty of his little girl; he reached out to grasp her hand, moistened by the tears of pleasure, and held it up in front of the crowds as if to demonstrate; then he went down to the street and looked at the parade that was soon to take place.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Jinglin saw his daughter growing more beautiful and intelligent, so he took her in his arms and played with her for a while. He then brought her to the street where he watched the crowd go by.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Shi-yin saw his daughter in a minute more than double her actual age transform herself into a beauty beyond description. He took her by the hand, carried her round to the front of the house, and left her there while he went round among the spectators entertaining his little princess.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct: Scholar Yin noticed that his daughter was becoming more and more delicate and charming, like a jade sculpture adorned with powder, and delightfully clever. Thus, he reached out to take her into his arms, playing with her for a while. Then, he brought her to the main street to watch the excitement of the various entertainments passing by.
unsloth/Qwen2-7B-Instruct(finetuned): Shi-yin could not help observing how fair and delicate of feature his little girl had become, and took her up in his arms and played with her for a while. Then he carried her into the street to look at the entertainments which were being given there.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3: The old man saw his daughter dressed in pink and looking like a jade. He was delighted and picked her up to play with her for a while, then took her to the street to see the bustling crowd.
unsloth/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.3(finetun: Shi-yin could see that his little girl had grown into a real beauty, and was so enamoured of her that he drew her to him for a cuddle, and then, still holding her by the hand, went with her outside to see the sights of the fair.
gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: The hermit sees his daughter becoming more and more like a polished jade, which delights him, so he extends his hand to receive her and hug her in his embrace to play with her again, and then leads her to the street to see the lively scene that will happen later.

Shi-yin saw that her cheeks were thoroughly rouged and her teeth perfectly aligned, and, though she was usually rather shy with strangers, made no objection to his taking her by the hand and fondling her for a bit before putting her down again and leading her out into the street, where they could see the various attractions on offer.

chinese: 一面方方正正的太阳旗在通红的朝霞下耷拉着，一柄柄刺刀上汪着葱绿色的光彩。

gradientai/Llama-3-8B-Instruct-Gradient-: A rectangular sun flag is fluttering straight and evenly in the red fog, and the blades of the swords are glowing with a verdant light.
